130084920504806.description:
The Great Bull Run is coming to Chicago on July 12th, 2014! Grab life by the horns and experience the rush of a lifetime as you sprint down a quarter-mile track with up to twenty-four 1,500-pound bulls hot on your heels. Cap off your run in our insanely fun tomato food fight, Tomato Royale, then celebrate all day long in our massive festival featuring rockin' music, great food, cold beer, games, and attractions! 

Not up for running with bulls? No problem! You can still watch all the action as a spectator or join in the fun as a participant in Tomato Royale! Be sure to read our Frequently Asked Questions (www.thegreatbullrun.com/faq/) for all the details on how the run is structured and remember: prices go up over time so don’t wait too long to sign up!
130084920504806.name: The Great Bull Run - Chicago

133408896834116.description:
Join Ustadh Hisham Mahmoud for lessons on the inner meanings of Surat al-Fatiha & for a taste of Fawakih's innovative Qur'anic Arabic curriculum. 

About the speaker: 
Hisham Mahmoud is an Arabic Lecturer at Harvard University, where he teaches all levels of Modern and Classical Arabic.

He has studied Arabic and its ancillary sciences with scholars in Egypt, Spain, Morocco, and Mauritania, where he pursued the disciplines of grammar, morphology, and rhetoric. He has held positions in Arabic at UCLA, Middlebury, and Yale University.

He has translated and edited several classical Islamic works on issues pertaining to ethics, jurisprudence, and legal theory, and has also lectured at dozens of universities nationwide on subjects pertaining to comparative religion.

Ust. Hisham is an advisory board member of al-Madina Institute and the Executive Editor for the Zaytuna Curriculum Series, which serves the four-year Bachelors Degree program for Zaytuna College, the first Muslim Seminary in North America.
133408896834116.location: Masjid Al-Faatir (1200 E. 47th St. Chicago, Illinois 60653)
133408896834116.name: Secrets of Qur'anic Arabic with Ust. Hisham Mahmoud

136681473172032.description:
One Tribe at Columbia College Chicago presents
F*CK DA POLICE: STORIES OF EXILE AND CONFINEMENT

A cage is lone bedroom's blinds drawn, walls always caving in (but never do)-- a foreign space you're given, your name written clearly on its outside, if only you could see that you belong (in a cage): Escape is an opening of the eyes. A stretch of an arm outside, looking in. Growing. And you're free.

Four readers open their eyes, stretch an arm toward
 a growing audience. We're all free.

Featured readers:
Bobby Biedrzycki
Conway At Columbia
Brontë Price
Frank Waln

OPEN MIC TO FOLLOW!
The event will also include an open mic portion to showcase 5-minute (2.5 page) stories from the audience.

PART 4 OF ONE TRIBE'S YEARLONG LIVE LIT SERIES
Curated by One Tribe Scholars Lance Taylor Cox and Brian Dragon Martin
136681473172032.location: Columbia College Chicago, 1104 S. Wabash, 8th floor, Chicago, IL 60605

Schedule can be downloaded here: http://bit.ly/taleefchicagoschedule 

MONTHLY CLASSES:

LIVING RIGHT
Borrowing from traditional texts and conventional wisdom, “Living Right” is a forum for newcomers to Islam, young people recommitting themselves to the Deen, or anyone seeking practical ways to progress spiritually.

Instructor: Usama Canon
Where: American Islamic College, 613 W Bittersweet Pl, Chicago  
When: Saturday, January 18th 1-3pm
Saturday, February 22nd 1-3pm
Saturday, March 29th 1-3pm
Cost: Free

QUARTERLY CLASSES:

INTRODUCING ISLAM 
This friendly, informal discussion is for anyone curious about Islam and Muslims. Feel welcome to bring your questions, concerns, and curiosity. Come and explore with us one of the world's largest faith traditions. For ages 16 and above.

Instructor(s): Alia Bilal, Mike Swies, and many more
Where: TBA
When: Sunday, February 16th, 12-4pm
Cost: Free
Registration Opens: January 19th
http://bit.ly/introducingislamchicago1

WORKSHOPS:

WAYFARING TO GOD 
A gathering for women, offering practical advice on purification of the heart and personal spiritual paths.  This workshop will discuss the translation of Habib Ali al-Jifri's "Wayfarers to God" as a spiritual guide.

Instructor:  Syeda Nejma Davis 
Where:  American Islamic College, 613 W Bittersweet Pl, Chicago
When:  Sunday, February 23rd 1-3pm
Cost:  Free
Registration Opens:  January 26th
Registration Link:  http://bit.ly/wayfaringtogod

SPECIAL EVENTS:

SCREENING & PANEL DISCUSSION:  PRISON BLUES
A screening and panel discussion highlighting a new Ta'leef Collective documentary, Prison Blues, written and directed by Mustafa Davis.  The documentary follows a group of formerly incarcerated and converts to Islam, exploring their lives and conversion stories.

Where:  Mandel Hall, University of Chicago, Reynolds Club, 1131 E 57th St, Chicago
When:  Friday, February 21st 7:30-10pm
Cost:  $10/person by February 16th
$15/person at the door
$5/students
General Registration:  http://bit.ly/prisonbluestaleef
Student Registration:  http://bit.ly/prisonbluesstudents

1377974745795655.description:
10 year old Blake Loudenber from Griffith Indiana will be celebrating his 1 year kidney anniversary on March 14, 2014.  Blake had his transplant done at the University of Chicago's Comer Children's Hospital in Illinois last year. He waited almost 8 years for a donor match to save his life. After many life threatening journeys, and  with his life still being at risk, Comer Children's Hospital continues to fight for him over and over.  Saving his life time and time again. Never giving up! In honor of Comer Children’s Hospital and the kidney donor who saved Blake’s life, we are asking that everyone help us donate New coloring books and  New boxes of crayons to the Comer Children's Hospital. Any other New and Non-Toxic Art supplies can be donated as well. We will have drop-off locations available for the entire month of March throughout Northwest Indiana. As soon as we confirm locations, I will update this event page so that everyone knows where they can take these items. Thank you all so much for your continued support for Blake, his family, and the community.

Confirmed drop off locations:

Griffith Indiana Police Department 
drop box available 24 hours at this location

BRIDGES' SCOREBOARD RESTAURANT & SPORTS BAR
 in Griffith Indiana during business hours. 

Wheatfield Lanes 
in Wheatfield Indiana during business hours. 

Team Toyota 
in Schererville during business hours. 

Walgreens
Located at the corner of Ridge Road and Colfax in Griffith Indiana.

NWI Fleet Maintenance Inc.
Located at 8765 Louisiana St in Merrillville Indiana.

CVS 
Located at 3835 45th St in Highland Indiana. 

Beiriger Elementary School
located at 601 N Lillian St in  Griffith Indiana. 

Strack & Van Til 
 located at 9632 Cline Ave in Highland Indiana.

              This coloring book and crayon drive will run from 
                            March 1, 2014 – March 31, 2014. 										

                Thank you for helping us give back in a BIG way.
 
                      Follow Blake’s journey on Facebook :
                https://www.facebook.com/AMiracleForBla

1398138257119717.description:
IAN MAKSIN @ CITY WINERY 
APRIL 14, 8pm, doors open 6pm

Special guests:  Ani Gogova - piano, Gabriel Datcu - guitar

TICKETS ON SALE $15 FOR A LIMITED TIME!
First 100 tickets $3 off with code IAN3 http://www.citywinery.com/chicago/tickets/ian-maksin-4-14.html

Ian Maksin is back to City Winery with an all-new program ranging from baroque and classical music to progressive jazz!!  This time he will throw in  a couple of extra treats: turning cello into a whole orchestra with a loop pedal as well as singing some of his favorite ballads in different languages...   He will be joined by guest artists, Bulgarian pianist Ani Gogova and Romanian guitarist Gabriel Datcu.

Cellist and composer Ian Maksin has gained international recognition for his beautiful tone and distinctive style, as well as his uniquely charismatic way with the audience.  He performs over 100 concerts annually in the USA and Europe, and his performances have been broadcast on NPR, PBS as well as on national radio and television in many European countries.  In Chicago, Maksin has been a frequent guest on WFMT, WBEZ and Chicago Tonight, his performances appear regularly as “Critic’s Pick” in Chicago Tribune as well as the Time Out Magazine.  In 2012 he was named “Citizen Musician” by the Chicago Symphony Orchestra for his contribution to the city’s musical life and community engagement.   Apart from being recognized as one of the leading classical artists, Maksin has taken the cello well outside its conventional scope and plays jazz, world music, blues, flamenco, rock, R&B, pop, and has collaborated with such artists as Sting, Andrea Bocelli, P. Diddy, Snoop Dogg and Gloria Estefan.

Official Website: www.ianmaksin.com

1399126453684408.description:
Hi friends! I'd like to invite you to join me (team name still under consideration- currently 'Team McPartland') for the 2014 ABTA Breakthrough for Brain Tumors 5k Run and Walk on April 27th in Chicago! If you can't participate you can still make a donation! (links with directions below)

As you may know, the past few months my mom has undergone treatment for a brain tumor. This is what inspired me to get involved in Brain Tumor awareness, education, and fundraising. You can read more about my experience on my Fundraising Page. 

I've never done one of these fundraising things before but this is a cause I believe in with all my heart so I figured I'd give it a shot. If you feel inspired to run with me - great! Donate - great! If you read this message all the way through and just take a moment to lend your thoughts and prayers to the 700,000 people living with brain tumors today - great! 

I can't thank my friends and family enough for the love and support I've received from them through the last few months. Thank you for your support!


Link to Kaitlyn's Fundraising Page:
http://hope.abta.org/site/TR/ABTAEvent/General?px=2352863&pg=personal&fr_id=2981


Link to Team Fundraising Page 
http://hope.abta.org/site/TR/ABTAEvent/General?team_id=26560&pg=team&fr_id=2981

1416779711903706.description:
ONE NIGHT IN CHICAGO - MIT TECHNO ALT WERDEN - HOME RECORDINGS


★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Techno Oldschool-Legende aus Chicago im Cembrankeller

★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★


Am Freitag den 9. Mai bekommt Linz hohen Besuch aus USA. Der aus Chicago stammende Techno-Pionier MIKE DEARBORN kommt in den Linzer Cembrankeller. Als DJ und Produzent seit den frühen Neunziger, zählt er wohl mit zu einem der ganz großen in diesem Genre. Als junger Produzent unter der Flagge des berühmten Labels Djax up Beats, welches heuer das 25 Jahre Jubiläum feiert, trug Mike Dearborn maßgeblich mit zu dessen Erfolg bei. Er schaffte es sogar auf dem Album „Homeworks“ von „Daft Punk“ namentlich als Inspiration erwähnt zu werden. Den weltweit gebuchten DJ-Namen Mike Dearborn kennt man in Europa von großen intern. Festivals und Raves wie z.B. Mayday und Awakenings. Unser Motto von "Mit Techno alt werden- Feiern wie früher" wird seinem Titel gerecht, wenn sein 120 Minuten Oldschhool-Set den Cembrankeller in einen Dampfkessel verwandelt und für eine unvergessliche Nacht sorgen wird. Support bekommt Mike Dearborn von Martin Mueller, dem Linzer Labelbesitzer von „HOME Recordings, welcher mit seinem Label seit 2006 konsiquent seinen Weg verfolgt und dafür mit internationaler Aufmerksamkeit belohnt wurde. So hat ihn Dave Clarke auf der Playlist und der bekannte DJ und Producer Mark EG, Redakteur beim Tilllate Magazine vergleicht ihn mit einen Global Player wie Robert Hood.  Chicago- Legende Mike Dearborn ist auf der 2011 erschienenen 12 Vinyl von Martin Muellers HOME Recordings namens „Asso“ mit einem Remix vertreten.

Weiters supporten Mike Dearborn die beiden bekannten Oldschool-Veteranen und DJ‘s Burne Maximilian und Dean Lee. Allesamt erfahrene Vinyl-DJ‘s. 

Straight Techno mit einem Schuss Acid :-)

Feiert mit uns eine unvergessliche Nacht !



★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★

♫  MIKE DEARBORN - Chicago USA/ Djax up Beats ♫

★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★

♫  Burne Maximilian ♫

5 kwietnia Klancyk! wystąpi na Festiwalu Improwizacji w Chicago ze spektaklem Zaburzone Osobowości!

Improwizatorzy z całego świata marzą o występie na scenie w Chicago, mateczniku impro. Chicago Improv Festival (CIF) daje teraz Klancykowi taką szansę. To nad jeziorem Michigan narodziła się współczesna sztuka improwizacji teatralnej, a scena chicagowska od lat jest wzorcem dla osób uprawiających tę formę sztuki. Jedna z dziennikarek opisujących chicagowski Festiwal Improwizacji napisała o nim „When it comes to improv, Chicago is Mecca”. 

CIF to nastraszy i najdłużej trwający festiwal improwizacji na świecie. Jego pierwsza edycja odbyła się w 1998 roku. CIF jest przeglądem najlepszych grup improwizowanych z Chicago, ze Stanów Zjednoczonych i całej reszty świata. 

Do tej pory polska improwizacja nie była obecna na scenie międzynarodowej. Klancyk, najstarsza w Polsce grupa impro, ma na koncie 8 lat występów, oraz odbytą w 2012 roku podróż do Chicago, gdzie zdobywaliśmy doświadczenie w teatrach iO i Second City (uczyli się tam m.in. Bill Murray, John Belushi, Mike Myers czy Robin Williams). Teraz przyszedł czas na zaprezentowanie swoich umiejętności przed amerykańską publicznością! 

Bujamy się na żyrandolu ze szczęścia, bo Klancyk jest pierwszą polską grupą w historii, której udało się zakwalifikować na ten festiwal. Nasz teatr będzie miał okazję promować polską improwizację w miejscu narodzin tej dziedziny sztuki.

Pakujcie walizki i lećcie z nami!

więcej informacji: http://chicagoimprovfestival.org/
spektakl: http://chicagoimprovfestival.org/cif-events/klancyk-twisted-personalities-improv-kandy/

Powered by culture.pl
1416810225240250.name: KLANCYK jedzie na CHICAGO IMPROV FESTIVAL!

1431956307021555.description:
What is Blacklight Run™?

Blacklight Run™ is a unique experience focused less on speed and more on Glow in the dark fun with friends and family. Glowing runners come from all different ages, shapes, sizes, and speeds; but everyone who shows up to get Glowed™ has the time of their life. Whether you are an avid runner or a walk around the park walker, the 3 miles of the Blacklight Run™ course will have you glowing and waiting for the next one!

How does it work?

The Blacklight Run™ has been setup with very simple rules:

1) White shirts (any white T-shirt will work) worn at the start line.

2) Glow covered runners at the Finish! Runner/walkers begin the 5k at the start line like a brand new canvas.

By the end, they look like they fell into a ghost busters movie and are covered with different colored Glow™. This is the first of its kind at night and is quickly sweeping the nation!

Each person running will receive:

- Blacklight Run T-Shirt
- Special Offers from Sponsors
- Race Bib
- Glow Pack to throw at the finish line!

What is the Glow?

Along the running path you will find Glow Zone's, which are associated with a designated color: green, pink, or blue. As the runners/walkers reach the Glow Zones they are showered with neon powder that glows under our high beam black lights. All products are 100% natural and non-toxic. At the end of the race there will be a Blacklight Run™ Party filled with Music pumping from the DJ, Glowing Neon Powder and tons of black lights!


What about the finish line?

Are you ready for the best After Race party on the PLANET. After the finish, participants are encouraged to stick around, celebrate, and see exactly how much Glow one person can handle. We will have Glow, and festivities that will make your Glowing head spin.

Stay Tuned

For the latest race updates and runner giveaways stay tuned to this web page, or follow Blacklight Run™ Facebook or Twitter pages.
1431956307021555.name: Blacklight Run™ - Chicago

1444613869104414.description:
Join The Post Family and Chicago Film Archives for a special evening of projected film and live music.

Revel in the experimental work of late Logan Square filmmaker JoAnn Elam. Stick around for a curated selection of your own resurrected celluloid home movie treasures.

Live musical accompaniment by Synesthetic, featuring: 
Angel Elmore : piano
Joe Vajarsky : tenor saxophone
Norman Long : field recordings
Dan Godston : trumpet
Lou Ciccoteli : drums

To view other events checkout: http://comfort.thepostfamily.com/

- - - 

The strength of a community hinges on the engagement of it’s members. Individual and collective growth is the direct result of an open, free-flowing exchange of information, ideas, resources and skills. The facilitation of platforms, environments and situations conducive to this type of interaction is central to the Post Family’s mission.

This March, the Post Family will leave the confines of their studio behind to call Logan Square’s Comfort Station home. Looking to the legacy of a “comfort station” as a public place of gathering—an architectural hub within a community that’s free and open to all—they believe this to be the perfect venue to bring their ideals to life.

Rather than mount a physical exhibition, the Post Family is curating a month of programming—a series of workshops, collaborations, performances, discussions and screenings designed to engage and unite the diverse Logan Square community. They will facilitate dialogue between residents old and new: families, professionals, artists, patrons, business owners and beyond. In addition to their own events, they will be partnering with a variety of “Family friends” – including Third Coast Audio Festival, Logan Square International Film Series (Comfort Films), and others – to diversify programming and enrich the level of dialogue throughout the month. Visitors will collaborate, debate, share meals, create artwork, and above all else, engage.
1444613869104414.name: Chicago Film Archives presents: JoAnn Elam & Logan Square Home Movie Night @ Comfort Station

1450407305191918.description:
Solstice Stained Glass and Larry Zgoda Studio will be collaborating to host Chicago's first Stained Glass Invitational Exhibit. Part of the Day of Glass, this event will focus on increasing awareness of the rich stained glass community in the area by offering discussions about issues central to the craft, as well as brief demonstrations of working with the medium. A more in-depth, live demonstration of window restoration and painting on stained glass will be underway through the course of the day, as different steps of a portrait will be painted on glass and kiln fired.

Hosts studios:

http://larryzgodastudio.com/

The Chicago Theatre community is coming together to participate in 30/30, a national reading scheme that celebrates US Latino theatre and the work of 30+ NoPassport playwrights and theatre makers.
This national initiative, spearheaded by Caridad Svich (NoPassport Theatre Alliance and Press) in collaboration with Dominic D’Andrea (One Minute Play Festival), brings a canon of work by contemporary Latino/a authors to stages across the United States.

Вас ждет незабываемый вечер в компании брутальных мужчин и роскошных дам! Бармены предложат Вам коктейли искусно замаскированные под кофе и чай, так как в Meresuu баре “Beluga Bay” будет действовать «сухой закон». В сигарной комнате бара Вы сможете насладиться элитными сигарами различных марок. Проникновенные звуки саксофона и чарующий голос солистки помогут вам погрузиться в атмосферу Чикаго 20 – 30-х годов.
Уважаемые гости, помните - это были опасные времена и поэтому будьте готовы к любым неожиданным приключениям!

Tere tulemast eelmise sajandi alguse kriminaalsesse Chicagosse!

Sind ootab unustamatu õhtu luksuslike naiste ja julmade meeste seltskonnas. Meresuu baaris kehtib alkohoolikeeld. Vaatamata sellele baarmanid pakuvad Sulle kokteile, mis on varjatud kohvi või tee nime all. Sigari toas saad maitsta ja nautida erinevat marki sigareid. Hingeline helide saksofon ja lummav solisti hääl viivad Sind eelmise sajandi 20.-30. aastate Chicagosse.

Kallis külaline, kui Sa tead, et see oli ohtlik aeg, siis ole valmis üllatusteks!

Zapraszamy na czwartą imprezę z cyklu Vatican Vibes. Po dźwiękach Los Angeles, Nowego Jorku i Berlina nadszedł czas na brzmienie typowe dla Chicago. 
▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂
TAX: 
10 PLN - Z LISTY FB DO GODZ. 23:59
20 PLN - WSZYSCY POZOSTALI
▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂

Juke house (i towarzyszący mu taniec footwork, terminy stosuje się często zamiennie) zaczął się formować już pod koniec lat 80., by w ostatnim pięcioleciu podbić międzynarodowe listy przebojów, blogi i festiwale muzyczne. Za narodziny juke house'u uważa się wczesne produkcje RP Boo bądź DJ Gantmana dla kultowego labelu Dance Mania. Juke jest pochodną ghetto house'u, nosi więc podobne cechy szczególne: niskobudżetowa produkcja, wykorzystanie dźwieków Rolanda 808 i 909, sample wokalne - zwykle nacechowane seksualnie. Wulgarne repetycje są tutaj podkręcone do tempa 160 BPM, co z synkopowanymi uderzeniami maszyn perkusyjnych powoduje prawdziwe szaleństwo na parkiecie. 

Z dumą prezentujemy naszego gościa:

☛ DJ EARL (TEKLIFE/Moveltraxx/Chicago)

Earl to najmłodszy bodaj członek kolektywu TEKLIFE, znanego w kraju głównie za pośrednictwem fenomenalnych występów DJ Rashada & DJ Spinna. Zaledwie 22-letni Earl wydał już trzy albumy (własnym sumptem) oraz dwie EPki - kolejno w Lil Pitch i Moveltraxx. Podobnie jak RP Boo, zaczynał swoją przygodę od tańca, później w 2008 roku poznał Rashada i Spinna. Zaczął tworzyć własne utwory, inspirując się nie tylko Traxmanem, ale również hip-hopowymi producentami jak J-Dilla czy Timbaland. DJ Earl reprezentuje nową generację chicagowskiego footworku, sampluje jazz, funk, pop i hip-hop, po czym zatapia to wszystko w charakterystycznych snare'ach i ciężkim subbassie.

http://www.soundcloud.com/djearlteckz
http://ghettoteknitianz.bandcamp.com/
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Deejay-Earl/217300085654

☛ Paide (Polish Juke/Wrocław)

DJ, recenzent muzyczny, aktywny działacz wrocławskiego radia internetowego radio-alternator.com, w ostatnim czasie równie intensywnie zaangażowany w projekt Polish Juke - inicjatywę promującą polskich producentów zainspirowanych footwork/juke z Chicago. Wielbiciel amerykańskiego undergroundu i wszelkich jego odmian: nowoorleańskiego NOLA Bounce, jersey club, trapu, ale 
przede wszystkim footwork i juke.

http://www.radio-alternator.com/
http://www.mixcloud.com/Paide/
https://www.facebook.com/polishjuke

☛ Musley (Polish Juke/Wrocław)

Musley to rzeszowski producent i dj specjalizujący się w ciężkich wałkach inspirowanych Rolandem 808. Poza gatunkami takimi jak juke nie pogardzi skocznym future garage czy halfstepowym drum and bassem. Jego kawałki znalazły się na kompilacjach World Wide Juke, Lowfreq Poland vol. 3., Music of the Future vol. 1 i Juke World Order vol. 1.

https://soundcloud.com/musley
https://www.facebook.com/Musley.yo

☛ DJ Alonzo (Lineout.pl/Warszawa)

Redaktor Lineout.pl, dziennikarz i promotor, współpracuje z magazynami VICE, Decoder Mag i Resident Advisor, współorganizuje z Jakubem Mihilewiczem Targi Niezależnych Wytwórni; w swoich setach stawia na eksperymentalny house i techno z wycieczkami w stronę najróżniejszych mikrogatunków.

https://soundcloud.com/deejay_alonzo

☛ DJ Smakowita Pajda (Lineout.pl/Ślůnsk)

Człowiek-smalec: tłusty i zwierzęcy, ale pożywny i tani. Wśród przyjaciół słynie z nietypowego zapachu. Wytaczając nową jakość na rodzimej scenie klubowej, zdecydował się nie podpisywać umowy patronackiej z żadnym producentem alkoholu - zamiast tego wybrał produkty garmażeryjne.

Support:

Lineout.pl
Aktivist
future-bass.pl
PORCYS
Screenagers.pl
Polish Juke
1459564170944701.name: ☯ Vatican Vibes ☮ pres. DJ EARL [TEKLIFE/Chicago], Paide, Musley, DJ Alonzo, DJ Smakowita Pajda *LISTA FB*

1470115926545051.description:
(Now with 100% More Public Invite!)

A Hearty Huzzah to Pillow Warriors Young and Old!

BEHOLD! The time of the Great Pillow Reckoning is soon upon us! We shall gather in our masses, bearing our pillows on high, and win the glorious victory of ridiculous horseplay!

The field of battle shall once again be Wrigley Square, at Randolph & Michigan!
MAP: http://tinyurl.com/CPFD2014

For those driving in, easy parking can be had at the Millennium Park Garage at 5 S. Columbus.

For those coming in on pubtran, the Randolph Metra station and the Randolph & Michigan bus stop (or the Michigan & Randolph bus stop) are both right there.

After the battle, join us across the street for Chicago style deep dish at Giordano's!

INTERNATIONAL PILLOW FIGHT DAY RULES OF ENGAGEMENT
________________________________________
1. PLEASE DO NOT BRING FEATHER OR DOWN PILLOWS.
2. IF YOU DO BRING A FEATHER OR DOWN PILLOW, DO NOT TEAR IT OPEN.
3. IF YOU SEE SOMEONE TEARING OPEN A PILLOW, PLEASE ASK THEM TO STOP AND HELP CLEAN IT UP! LITTER IS BAD, MMKAY?
4. DO NOT SWING AT PERSONS WHO ARE NOT PARTICIPATING.
5. DO NOT SWING AT PERSONS NOT HOLDING PILLOWS.
6. DO NOT SWING AT PERSONS HOLDING CAMERAS.
7. SMALL CHILDREN ARE FRAGILE! PLEASE PUMMEL THE HOBBITS WITH CARE!
8. WATCH OUT FOR VEHICLE AND FOOT TRAFFIC- STAY OUT OF STREETS AND WALKWAYS AND TRY NOT TO INTERFERE WITH NON-PARTICIPANTS WHO ARE GOING ABOUT THEIR BUSINESS.
9. OBEY ALL POSTED LAWS AND INSTRUCTIONS FROM LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICIALS.
10. PLEASE, NO ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES OR RECREATIONAL SUBSTANCES (EVEN THE LEGAL ONES). THIS IS A FAMILY EVENT!
11. EVERYONE IS ENCOURAGED TO STAY AND HELP CLEAN UP IF NECESSARY!

International Pillow Fight Day is a global celebration of the ancient art of pillow fighting. Throughout history, pillow fighting has been the civilized form of battle which results in victory for all who take part. Come, raise your trustiest war-pillow to remind destructive forces everywhere that the only truly valiant fights are won with stuffing and cloth!

We also want this event to be safe and respectful to the community that hosts it, so please read and follow the guidelines on the opposite side of the flyer. We're here to have fun and make people smile, and maybe even to make some people realize that life isn't all work and no play; but there will always be those for whom such pastimes are "childish" or "inappropriate". These people can't be saved, so just let them be. Additionally, this is a family friendly and community friendly event, so please don't engage in any illegal or reckless behaviors. Pillow fighting can be a blast without anybody needing to take a ride downtown. Let's make sure the only people getting smacked are those who want to be!

A word about feathers- I know some pillow fighters really enjoy the flying feathers, but the simple truth is that a huge blizzard of down floating around the streets, parks, and into the river is a nightmare to clean up, not just for us, but for the dedicated city sanitation employees who are probably underpaid and overworked. Beyond that, it's not kind to the environment, or to our fellow citizens. So, like the owl says, "Give a Hoot, Don't Pollute!"

Trash bags and gloves will be provided for those who want to help clean up after the event. Heck, you can even clean up the regular litter if you want- no reason we can't give back a little, right? When clean up is done, please join us for post-battle refreshments and tales of heroic deeds at a local eatery!

There are cities all around the world, from Amsterdam to Zurich, participating in Pillow Fight Day, and you can see all the cool places joining the battle at pillowfightday.com

Let's make sure Chicago remains one of the most memorable, fantastic, fun, and safe cities to pillow fight in, and let's show those other cities that we can pummel with the best of 'em!
________________________________________
1470115926545051.name: Global Pillow Fight Day Chicago 2014 - The Case of the Pillow Pugilists!

The promoters bill this as a "fun and exciting event!" To have cattle stampeding in a closed area,while people try and not get trampled? I am appalled that NO animal rights groups are speaking out on this. www.thegreatbullrun.com is the link to the site for more details.
So...why am I bitching about this? Well, I also started an online petition to shut them down! 
Here is the link for the petition.Please sign and share! Thanks and peace and love!
http://www.gopetition.com/petitions/no-bull-run-chicago-2014/signatures.html
I appreciate if you RSVP,but would REALLY rather you SIGN the petition! Smooches!

Patty Vaccarella
156839404512463.name: Say NO to the Great Bull Run,Chicago 2014

Delta 9, is a hardcore techno DJ/producer from Chicago.
The name "Delta 9" comes from delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol (Δ9-THC), the main psychoactive substance found in the cannabis plant.
Delta 9 has been producing since 1994, starting with Deep 13 & The Hate Tank on Drop Bass Network Records. His many releases with Industrial Strength Records date back to 1995. Delta 9 is also owner of Psychotik Records, and has over 40 solo 12 inch releases (including under his alias The Imposters).
Delta 9 has appeared on over 200 compilations including the Thunderdome series, Hellraiser, Third Movement's Demolition, the Mystery Land[disambiguation needed] series, and the Masters of Hardcore compilations. He has also done many remixes for bands including Corrosion of Conformity, Napalm Death, The Berzerker, Agoraphobic Nosebleed and Soil.
On January 18, 2008, Delta 9 announced that his new label, "Devil Times Nine" would start distributing his works through Sound&Base Music, starting with DTN1 in February 2008.

198450500353336.description:
Tickets onsale: http://bit.ly/ChicagoREOtickets

CHICAGO & REO SPEEDWAGON SET TO LAUNCH CO-HEADLINING SUMMER 2014 TOUR
 
Summer Tour Will Take Both Bands To Dozens Of Cities Across The U.S.

Tickets On Sale Starting January 17 Through The Live Nation Mobile App And LiveNation.com

Legendary rock bands, REO Speedwagon and Chicago, announced today they will kick off a co-headlining tour this summer.  The 15-date summer tour, presented by Live Nation, will take the bands through major metropolitan areas across the United States including New York City, Boston, Dallas, Phoenix, Detroit and more with even more dates to be announced soon.  Tickets for the general public go on sale on starting Friday, January 17 through the Live Nation mobile app and at www.livenation.com.  

Citi® cardmembers will have access to presale tickets beginning Wednesday, January 15 at 10:00 AM local time through Citi's Private Pass® Program.  For complete presale details, visit www.citiprivatepass.com.  Live Nation mobile app users (available for both iOS and Android) will have access to presale tickets beginning Thursday, January 16 at 10:00 AM local time.  Band fan club presales will begin on January 14 at 10:00 AM local time.  All presales end at 10:00 PM local time on Thursday, January 16.  

"It's ironic, that these two legendary bands, who both have roots in Illinois, were label-mates (Columbia/Epic) in the 70's, and experienced waves of immense success in the 80's and 90's, and have somehow continued to consistently make compelling music, both in-studio and on tour.... have never before performed together!" says Chicago's Robert Lamm.  "This situation is about to change, as Chicago and REO will perform together during the concert's encore and present a finale that will thrill their audiences. As a musician who has always respected REO's skills, I look forward to our first rehearsals early this summer.  This will be fun!"

"With so many personal connections between various members of REO and Chicago, it is amazing that we have never actually toured together. I love it that the Chicago guys feel the way we do about truly playing together when you tour together," says REO Speedwagon's Kevin Cronin.  "Can you imagine the Chicago horn section on 'Roll With the Changes'? That would blow my mind! This tour promises to deliver some unique music from two bands who have made a ton of hit records, share that Midwest work ethic, and still refuse to sit back on their past accomplishments. We both keep raising the bar, challenging ourselves, and rocking hard... and the audience is the ultimate winner. We are psyched... I can't wait for this tour."

All dates below subject to change.  All shows on sale January 17 unless otherwise noted.

July 31      Concord, CA    Concord Pavilion 
August 2	Phoenix, AZ	Comerica Theater
August 4	Denver, CO	Red Rocks Amphitheatre
August 7	Kansas City, MO	Starlight Theatre
August 10	Indianapolis, IN	Klipsch Music Center
August 12	Detroit, MI	DTE Energy Music Theatre
August 13	Cincinnati, OH	Riverbend Music Center
August 15	Hartford, CT	XFINITY Theatre
August 16	Holmdel, NJ	PNC Bank Arts Center

August 24	Atlanta, GA	Chastain Park Amphitheatre (on sale TBA)
August 31	Dallas, TX	Gexa Energy Pavilion

205365846335096.description:
What is Foam Glow 5K™?

Foam Glow 5K™ is a fun filled experience exposing runners to Glowing Foam and a ton of Blacklights all over the course. Glowing runners come from all different ages, shapes, sizes, and speeds. Whether you are a long term runner or a walk around the park stroller, the 3 miles of the Foam Glow 5K™ course will have you shining brite and waiting for the next run.

How does it work?

The Foam Glow 5K™ has been setup with very simple rules:

1) White shirt (any white T-shirt will work) worn at the start line. The more white you wear the better.

2) Foam Glow 5K™ runners sprinting through Foam Glow™ Zones to the Finnish line!

Runner/walkers begin the 5k at the start line like a brand new canvas. By the end, they look like they fell into a tye-dye machine and are covered with different colored foam that glows under black lights.

What is the Foam Glow™?

Along the running path you will find Foam Glow™ Zone's, which are associated with a designated color: Orange, Pink, or Orange. As the runners/walkers reach the Foam Glow™ Zones, They they will run through different color foam that Glows in the Dark under our high intensity black lights. All products are 100% natural and non-toxic. At the end of the race there will be a Foam Glow 5K™ after party filled with Music pumping from the stage, Foam Glow™ and tons of black lights!

Every Registered Runner gets:

- Foam Glow 5K™ Event T-Shirt
- Get blasted by foam at our Glow Zones
- Sonsor Goodies
- The best night of their life


What about the finish line?

Are you ready for the best After Race party in the world? After the finish, participants are encouraged to stick around, celebrate, and see exactly how much fun one person can handle. In most locations we will have food, Foam Glow 5K™, and festivities that will make your Foam Glowed head spin.

Don't forget to get the latest updates on our facebook page!
205365846335096.name: Foam Glow 5K™ - Chicago

219896894885566.description:
Wavelength Presents:

CHICAGO UNDERGROUND DUO
http://northernspyrecords.com/artist/chicago-underground-duo/
Tide pools of percussion, coral reefs of mbira, kelp forests of cornet. You and the earth’s surface are 70% water. So THIS is “world music.” Rob Mazurek and Chad Taylor tour in support of their new album, Locus, out on Northern Spy. (Members of Tortoise, Marc Ribot Trio, Exploding Star Orchestra, Sao Paolo Underground)

NOT THE WIND, NOT THE FLAG
http://notthewindnottheflag.bandcamp.com/
An avalanche of broken instruments raging down from mystic peaks. Soily caves and swollen echoes. Shrill metallics and warbling unease. Improv stalwarts Colin Fisher and Brandon Valdivia coalesce to engineer sonic liquid earthquakes and zen aural explosions. (Members of Mas Aya, Pachamama, Colin Fisher.)

KING WEATHER
http://mechanicalforestsound.blogspot.ca/2013/07/recording-king-weather.html
Steve Ward prays to the shrine of trombone drone. D. Alex Meeks shovels out the disheveled drum crackle of KC Accidental. They meet on a holy plain, unseen but heard. Pulsing distant glory like a spirit army marching to the beckon of trumpet bearing angels. (Members of Hooded Fang, Caribou, Pick a Piper, Holiday Rambler.)

+ DJ Daniel Vila
++ General Chaos Visuals

Thursday May 1
@ The Garrison
1197 Dundas St. W.
Doors 8:00 PM / 19+

Tickets $12 advance at Rotate This + Soundscapes + Ticketfly.com

This is Wavelength #597 - Programmed by Jonny Dovercourt & Adam Bradley.

221467431368320.description:
The  Operature is a live performance and augmented reality (AR) poem engaging themes of anatomical science and spectacle. The work’s choreography and use of technology are influenced by research into a series of diverse anatomical histories including early-modern surgical theatres, Francis Glessner Lee's miniature crime scene re-enactments known as the Nutshell Studies of Unexplained Death, and The Stud File, an autobiographical record of the sexual exploits of Samuel Steward, a 20th century tattoo artist, gay pornographer, and friend of Gertrude Stein.

 The performance is extended by a 25 screen interactive exhibition on the ground floor based on the concept of an operating theatre. The Operature includes an interactive operating table that controls screen-based content and distributes virtual AR overlays that can be viewed through mobile devices. A smart-phone is not required as the work's elaborate set includes a series of viewing stations. 

 ATOM-R is a provisional collective exploring forensics, anatomy, and 21st century embodiment through performance, language and emerging technologies. Participants include Mark Jeffery (choreography), Judd Morrissey (technology and dramaturgical systems), Justin Deschamps, Sam Hertz, Christopher Knowlton, and Blake Russell,(collaborators/performers) with Meghan Moe Beitiks (Technical Director), Andrew Pace (Textile Artist), Laura Prieto-Velasco (Prop / Jeweller)  Alfredo Salazar - Caro (New Media Artist), Bryan Saner (Master Carpenter), Kate Hampel (Costumes), Company Manager Stephanie Acosta and Studio Assistant Alexandria Eregbu.

ATOM-R co-founders Judd Morrissey and Mark Jeffery are a collaboration merging digital literary practices and performance (2003 - ). A given piece may have no singular fixed form is alternately or simultaneously presented as internet art, durational live installation or a performance of fixed length. Both artists were members of Goat Island Performance Group.

The work is partially supported by a grant from the Chicago Dancemakers Forum and commissioning support from the European research group ELMCIP (Electronic Literature as a Model for Creativity and Innovation in Practice) in collaboration with Edinburgh College of Art and New Media Scotland. The piece has also been supported by The School of the Art Institute of Chicago and by artist's workshops at Dance4, the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland, York St John University and the Department of English at King’s College London and supported by the Innovation programme at the Cultural Institute at King’s College London. The work is also supported by the National Museum of Health and Medicine Chicago with the collective being artists in residence at the Museum. 

 

PLEASE NOTE ALL TICKET SALES GO TO ATOM-R's LINKS HALL FISCAL ACCOUNT. ALL DONATIONS ARE GRATEFULLY RECIEVED IN THE OPERATING COST OF THIS PRODUCTION AND PAYING THE ARTISTS FOR THEIR TIME AND WORK ON THE PRODUCTION 


Please support & follow our developing work and research:
http://atom-r.tumblr.com/
http://atom-r-rehearsal.tumblr.com/
http://www.judisdaid.com
http://www.markjefferyartist.org/collaboration.html

223186981210648.description:
CHICAGO CONNECTIONS
Jon Rune Strøm - kontrabass
Tollef Østvang - trommer
Keefe Jackson - klarinett / sax
Josh Berman - kornett

SKRAP
Anja Lauvdal - synth
Heida Karine Johannesdottir Mobeck - tuba

CHICAGO CONNECTIONS

Å hildrande du, for en kveld dette ser ut til å bli. Fra the windy city som sida tjuetallet har produsert både gangstere og jazzmusikere av verdensformat kommer klarinettist/saksofonist Keefe Jackson og kornettist Josh Berman. De to har blitt viktige bestanddeler av den vitale scena i Chicago, sammen med gamle kjenninger som Jeb Bishop, Ken Vandermark og Fred Lonberg-Holm. Denne kvelden stiller de med den norske bassisten Jon Rune Strøm og trommisen Tollef Østvang, som vi Blow Out-folk har blitt kjent med i ekstraordinært raffe band som henholdsvis Frode Gjerstad Trio , SAKA, The Way Ahead og All Included. Forvent øs-pøs fuckings frijazz.


SKRAP
Skrap starta i følge Anja Lauvdal og Heida Karine Johannesdottir Mobeck sjøl etter at de to blei låst inne i et lite rom med to bassamper. Tidligere har de to skapt liv og rør med Your Headlights Are On og fortsetter med de gjennom band som Broen og Mummu. Lauvdal er ellers å høre i Moskus, men nå er det altså killer comboen av hennes synther og Mobecks elektrisk modifiserte tuba som gjelder. Funky, weird, bråkete og veldig Blow Out! 

Sjekk ut folk på nett:
Skrap: http://www.mummucollective.com/skrap.html
Tollef Østvang: http://www.tollefostvang.com
Keefe Jackson: http://keefejackson.com/
Josh Berman: http://joshberman.net/

Jazzmusikarar i Oslo var jorda, Konsertforeninga var frøet som vart sådd; Blow Out! var den blomen som sprang opp.
223186981210648.name: Blow Out! - Chicago Connection + Skrap

230818197122883.description:
With its members hailing from Berlin and Tel Aviv, Baladino is a Mediterranean folk band that offers fresh, yet deeply authentic interpretations of traditional Jewish Sephardic and Ladino (Judeo-Spanish) melodies. This music was born from Jews exiled from Spain and Portugal, traveling through the former Ottoman lands: Turkey, Greece, Yugoslavia, Bulgaria, and Morocco. As such, the group brings together instruments and traditions from the wide span of cultures that fed into this musical language historically, updating it with their own youthful energy and contemporary backgrounds in jazz improvisation and electronica. Embracing the old and the new, members perform on instruments both ancient and modern, and have made names for themselves collectively and individually in traditional settings and on YouTube.

Yael Badash - Lead Vocal 
Jonathan (Yonnie) Dror - Wind Instruments 
Thomas Moked - String Instruments
Daniel Sapir - Upright Bass
Yshai Afterman - Percussion

Photo by Omri Barel
230818197122883.name: Baladino in Chicago, USA

235259863346494.description:
WORKS BY

Sidra Bell, Mónica Cervantes, Robyn Mineko Williams and Nick Pupillo  

One of the world's newest contemporary companies takes the stage to present their first Spring Season showcasing its inaugural repertoire. Artistic Director Nick Pupillo presents two signature works, Senza di te and Impetere. Exploring his choreographic range, Pupillo visits the worlds of the seamless and sensual, as well as the athletic and powerful. Landings, Chasms, by New York-based choreographer Sidra Bell, explores human relationships and intimacy in a stark, industrial environment. Completing the program are two world premieres by Mónica Cervantes, a 2013 Dance Magazine "25 to Watch", and Chicago's own Robyn Mineko Williams, making for a program of innovative, dynamic works.

Jimkata
http://www.jimkata.com
Jimkata’s innovative, fan-funded record Die Digital turned heads of critics, musicians and fans when it dropped late in the Fall of 2012, solidifying the band’s reputation as a forward-thinking artist to pay attention to. Having been a mainstay of the Northeast “jam circuit” for years, Jimkata’s refined “electro rock” sound – one of a band that has found it’s voice after years of experimentation – is in many ways more “indie rock” than jam, more 90′s dance than EDM, more lyrical than instrumental, yet the band manages to keep the jam, EDM and technically advanced instrumental elements intact as it carves out a new path for themselves and many of their peers who were inspired by Die Digital. Jimkata’s relevant, quotable lyrics create moods not just for the fleeting moments, but for the lifestyle of an entire generation, and the sum of the music and songwriting appeals to fans of artists like MGMT, LCD Soundsystem, Talking Heads and the best of the ’90′s pop-rock world. A staple of the festival circuit from the Rockies to the Atlantic, Jimkata’s 2013 festival schedule included heavy hitters like Summer Camp (Chillicothe, IL), Gathering of The Vibes (Bridgeport, CT), Catskill Chill (Hancock, NY), Rootwire (Logan, OH) among many others.

Chicago Funk Mafia 
The derivation of the term Mafia is nebulous, but thought to originate from the arabic slang term "mahyas"-which means aggressive, proud, or boastful.

245188452323392.description:
Shows at 7PM & 10PM

“The Bladerunner Project, a John Zorn outfit including the godlike talents of Zorn on his signature instrument, prolific modern musician and bassist Bill Laswell, and heavy metal drumming powerhouse Dave Lombardo (Slayer, Fantômas, etc.) will deliver an electrifying performance at Reggie’s for Bladerunner’s United States premiere as well as their ONLY midwestern date on Saturday, May 3nd, 2014. The Chicago date will only be preceded by a Bladerunner performance at the Adelaide Festival in Australia in March of 2014. The music created by these gentlemen is something to experience first hand. It’s not jazz, it’s not rock, it’s not funk, but all of these combined.”

BLADERUNNER (featuring Zorn / Laswell / Lombardo)	

“John Zorn is an American avant-garde composer, arranger, producer, saxaphonist and multi-instrumentalist with hundreds of album credits as performer, composer and producer across a variety of genres including jazz, rock, hardcore, classical, surf, metal, klezmer, soundtrack, ambient and improvised music. Zorn has stated “All the various styles are organically connected to one another. I’m an additive person – the entire storehouse of my knowledge informs everything I do.” For Zorn “Composing is more than just imagining music—it’s knowing how to communicate it to musicians. And you don’t give an improviser music that’s completely written out, or ask a classical musician to improvise. I’m interested in speaking to musicians in their own languages, on their own terms, and in bringing out the best in what they do. To challenge them and excite them.”

“Bill Laswell ranks among the most prolific of modern musicians, being involved in hundreds of recordings with many collaborators from all over the world. Laswell’s music draws upon many different genres, most notably funk, various world music, jazz, dub and ambient styles. He has also played or produced music from the noisier, more aggressive end of the rock spectrum, such as hardcore punk and metal. Some of the acts Laswell has worked with include Method of Defiance, The Golden Palominos, Praxis, Massacre, Material, Buckethead, Painkiller, Ashes, Tabla Beat Science, Iggy Pop and Herbie Hancock.”

“Dave Lombardo is a Cuban American drummer and a co-founding member of the American thrash metal band Slayer. He performed with Slayer on seven albums, including their groundbreaking 1986 release Reign In Blood and their 2006 release Christ Illusion, for which he received critical praise. Lombardo’s music career has spanned more than 25 years, during which he has been involved in the production of 29 commercial recordings extending over a number of genres with bands such as Grip Inc., Fantômas, Philm, and Testament in addition to Slayer. Lombardo is most widely known as a very aggressive and exceptionally skilled heavy metal drummer. His use of the drums have been called “astonishingly innovative” and earned him the title “the godfather of double bass” from Drummer World. Over his career, he has had a significant influence on the metal scene and has inspired many modern metal drummers, particularly within both thrash metal and death metal.”
245188452323392.name: Bladerunner (Two Shows)

257413187771533.description:
Frustrated with Islamophobes in media and politics defaming the Prophet? 

Fuming over the recent anti-Islam Hollywood movie?

Feeling helpless? 

Hate groups in the U.S. have invested at least $140 million dollars to attack our Prophet and Islam. Isn't it time we invested in defending our faith?

Join Sound Vision's ground-breaking International Seerah conference for the first time in Chicago, "Stand with the Prophet in Honor and Respect" on April 19th, 2014, to be part of the solution!

This is not an event. It is the beginning of a movement. A movement to defend Prophet Muhammad, his person, and his message. Salla Allahu Alaihe wa Sallam. 

This conference will raise funds to establish a Strategic Communication Center for the Muslim community, which will develop effective responses to anti-Islamic attacks, as well as to train young Muslims in media.

----- When: Saturday, April 19, 2014. 4:30pm CST for appetizers, registration and Asr. the program begins at 5:30 PM Sharp. 

----- Where: Donald E. Stephens Convention Center, 9291 Bryn Mawr Ave, Rosemont, IL 60018

----- Tickets: $30 per person (Includes appetizers, program, parking & the dinner). After April 13, $50.
 
http://www.soundvision.com/chicago
1-800-432-4262

------ CONFIRMED SPEAKERS:

Lord Nazir Ahmed (UK), Dr. Abdalla Idris Ali (Canada), Prof. John Esposito (DC), Sister Ayesha Adawiyya (NY), Shk. Kifah Mustafa, Imam Abdul Malik Mujahid, Imam Ousman Drame, Imam Musa Azam

Nasheeds, Naat, Hamd in English, Urdu, Arabic, Bangla.

--- Lord Nazir Ahmed from UK is a member of the British House of Lords.He founded the British Muslim Councillors' Forum and was aJustice of the Peace between 1992 and 2000. He was both the first Asian councillor of Rotherham and the town's youngest magistrate. He led the first delegation on behalf of the British Government on the Muslim pilgrimage of the Hajj.

--- Professor John Esposito of Georgetown University, our keynote speaker, may be the most prominent scholar attacked by Muslim haters. World governments, corporations, universities, and the media consults him as a balanced non-Muslim voice on Islam. A former President of the Middle East Studies Association of North America and of the American Council for the Study of Islamic Societies, he is currently the President of the American Academy of Religion. He is Editor-in-Chief of The Oxford Encyclopedia of the Islamic World (6 vols.); The Oxford Encyclopedia of the Modern Islamic World (4 vols.), The Oxford History of Islam, The Oxford Dictionary of Islam, and The Islamic World: Past and Present (3 vols.). His has authored more than 45 books and monographs which have been translated into more than 35 languages.

--- Abdalla Idris Ali, probably the most loved president of ISNA (1992-1997), he developed and implemented Islamic and Arabic Studies curricula for elementary and junior high students. He is considered a pioneer in the area of Islamic education in North America.

--- Aisha H.L. Al-Adawiya is the Founder of Women In Islam Inc., an organization of Muslim women which focuses on human rights and social justice. Ms. al-Adawiya represents Muslim women in United Nations forums.  She also coordinates Islamic input for the Preservation of the Black Religious Heritage Documentation Project of the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture.

Ms. Al-Adawiya serves on numerous boards related to the interests of the global Islamic community, including the Interfaith Center of New York; KARAMAH: Muslim Women Lawyers for Human Rights; New York Jobs With Justice; Greater New York Labor-Religion Coalition; Muslim Consultative Network; The Malcolm X & Dr. Betty Shabazz Memorial Educational and Cultural Center (The Shabazz Center).

Ms. Al-Adawiya is a guest host and producer on Tahrir, WBAI Pacifica Radio in New York City and specializes in developing educational forums on human rights and social justice, interfaith initiatives, cross-cultural understanding, and peace building.

--- Imam Ousmane Drami Mali is a graduate of Madinah who gives khutbas in four languages. 

--- Imam Musa Azam in an entrepreneur, an hafiz and an Imam in the greater Chicago land. 

--- Imam Abdul Malik Mujahid is President of Sound Vision, the Chair of the Parliament of World's Religions, Chair of Burma Task Force USA, a coalition of 19 national organizations of Muslims.

261849227308230.description:
Come join the New York City Bar Chorus in welcoming its Windy City counterpart, the Chicago Bar Association Chorus, at their first joint concert at the House of the Association. 

The New York City Bar Chorus, directed by Kathryn E. Schneider and accompanied by Matthew V. Grieco, just celebrated its 20th Anniversary last November with a standing-room-only show at the House of the Association.  It has staged more than 200 concerts at senior residences, homeless shelters, AIDS and cancer patient residences, and pediatric and rehabilitation facilities around the city, as well as for luminaries of the bench and bar. The City Bar Chorus has been heard on local and national television and public radio.

Now in its 8th year, the Chicago Bar Association Chorus, directed by Rebecca Patterson and accompanied by Janet Eckhardt, enhances the public's understanding and image of the Chicago Bar Association and offers opportunities for civic involvement and artistic expression.  The CBA Chorus typically performs classical masterworks, often in collaboration with the CBA Symphony Orchestra, in famed Chicago cultural and civic venues.  In its upcoming New York appearance, the CBA Chorus will feature traditional songs of the Americas.

Please join us for this unique collaboration between two historic bar associations!  

Suggested donation: $20 (adults) / $10 (seniors, students and children), tax-deductible and payable at the door by cash, check or credit card.  Proceeds to benefit the City Bar Fund and the New York City Bar Chorus.

Sponsored by: City Bar Chorus Committee, Dana M. Catanzaro and Heather L. Kalachman, Co-Chairs
261849227308230.name: Big Apple Razzle Dazzle: NYC Bar Chorus & Chicago Bar Ass'n Chorus Joint Concert

Cancer has ruined the lives of countless people around the world. Rarely in the international goth-industrial scene does one hear about it. On May 1st, 2008, Jim Semonik, longtime promoter, DJ, and frontman for electro-industrial band Rein, was diagnosed with stage 2B colorectal cancer. During a rigorous campaign of chemotherapy and radiation, Semonik’s passion for this music did not waver. On June 28th, 2008, 16 Volt’s Denial Highway Tour came through Pittsburgh courtesy of Jim. It was at this event that Semonik formulated the idea for a compilation that would not only be gargantuan in scale, but in quality as well. Jim asked 16 Volt frontman, Eric Powell, to be a part of it. Eric didn’t hesitate and thus Electronic Saviors was born.

When a person is stricken with a disease like cancer, it is important for the individual to not only focus on beating the disease, but have a goal for how to do it. Electronic Saviors is Jim’s way of not only giving back to the medical community that saved his life, but the goth-industrial community that he has so warmly embraced for the better half of his life. It is Jim’s way of crushing cancer once and for all.

In fall/winter of 2008, Semonik lost a portion of his digestive system and had to undergo a grueling program of post op chemotherapy. Jim almost lost his life due to a pancreatic infection from the chemo. This made the compilation of utmost importance. After recovering he began contacting bands throughout the scene that he had worked with and shared a great relationship with. It was not long before bands like Suicide Commando, Assemblage 23, Chemlab, Caustic, and his own band Rein would begin to work on all exclusive tracks and mixes for what would become one of the biggest compilations the scene has ever seen.

A grand total of 83 artists came together for this project, and it is with this that Jim wants to donate proceeds to the Center For Cancer Research and Wellness in Harrisburg, PA.

Saviors is a monumental 4 cd boxset, packaged nicely in DVD digipack format, featuring stunning artwork by Jeff Confer and a 12 page booklet including an essay from Jim and a drop card for a downloadable 5th cd. The content of the compilation covers the widest range of emotions that a cancer patient goes through. It ranges from melancholy moving songs (ThouShaltNot, Bow Ever Down, Encoder) to songs about the medical industry (SMP, Boole) to angry songs of loss (Suicide Commando, Rein, Acumen Nation) to pure anger and raging dance tracks (Nachtmahr, The Dark Clan, TERRORFAKT, Vicious Alliance), downtempo, ambient and tranquil pieces (Burikusu!!!, The Atomica Project), comedic (The Gothsicles, Caustic) and songs of hope (Interface, SD6 and Assemblage 23).

The success of the Electronic Saviors Project far exceeded everyone's expectations by having completely selling out of all copies of Volume 1, it saw well attended and packed live ES benefit shows/ release parties and  raised over $20,000 for the foundation of Cancer Research and Wellness. Well we all know that Cancer returning is any survivor's nightmare so Metropolis Records, in association with Distortion Productions presented Electronic Saviors Vol 2:Recurrence. This is a 6 or 8 disc (whichever you ordered) box set of exclusive tracks by some of the biggest names in the industrial genre to raise money for cancer research. Cancer survivor and long time promoter and DJ, Jim Semonik, assembled 142 artists from around the world.

This compilation contained 105 (standard edition) and 142 (premium edition) tracks in total, including new exclusive tracks and mixes by 16 Volt, Project Pitchfork, Covenant, Blutengel, Suicide Commando, System Syn, God Module, Cesium 137, The Dark Clan, Rein[Forced], Mesh and many more. Packaged in a DVD style digipak containing the 6 physical CDs as well as a bonus 2 cd digipack with sticker, wristband and 70 page BRICKS survivors stories booklet. Proceeds from this Boxset were donated to the Gilda's Club/Cancer Support Community (http://www.gildasclub.org/) and The Bone Marrow Foundation (http://www.bonemarrow.org/) where Jim Semonik and the Electronic Saviors project raised over $10,000 for those foundations

Fast Forward to 2014 and ES3: Remission….. "You are cured!" These words are a dream come true to any cancer patient. Scene promoter, DJ and frontman of electro-industrial act Rein[Forced], Jim Semonik, returns to give the vile disease of cancer another pummeling with a ton of his friends, comrades, heroes and allies in Electronic Saviors 3:Remission. Jim, creator of the series, recently celebrated 5 years cancer free and is eager to share his gift with the world. Semonik once again returns with an armada of talent to shake dance floors and crush eardrums. Brand new and exclusive tracks from Combichrist, 16 Volt, Hate Dept, Stromkern, Rein[Forced], Panic Lift, Ego Likeness, Left Spine Down, Aesthetic Perfection and many, many more make Electronic Saviors 3 an essential purchase. Limited to 1000 copies, this volume is expected to sell out quickly and become a collector's item. The Electronic Saviors series continues to grow with this 3rd volume. Jim once again dedicates this volume to anyone who has been a victim of cancer in any way, shape or form.

Join us for this special event that boasts artists from the compilation (as well as a guest from ES2) as they all come together to help raise awareness on the subject and also to celebrate the strength and resolve that cancer survivors show. All proceeds from this unique live event will go directly to the Gilda's Club/Cancer Support Community. The first Electronic Saviors Benefit show that we put together in 2010 had a near capacity turnout and the second edition of the Chicago release party saw outstanding performances from Ego Likeness, The Gothsicles and Cryogen Second. We are pleased to announce the special addition of a ES2 boxset artist, Servitor, who absolutely destroyed with his live set recently while on tour with Ego Likeness. He goes on early but if there was ever a opening support artist that you had to see than Servitor drum would be it!  Yes this evening starts a little early but this event will fill to capacity quickly and we would hate to have to turn people away at the door for such a good cause so please plan your evening accordingly.

 IVARDENSPHERE:
iVardensphere: Singularity
Many who have seen iVardensphere are familiar with the intensity the band puts into their tribal performance. There have been upwards of 8 drummers on stage at a time during their shows creating that familiar rhythmic 'wall of sound'. The band has two sides, however. 
Scott Fox's Singularity focuses on the electronic side of the project. With an emphasis on improvisation and crunch, no Singularity performance with be a clone of a previous show. Featuring a table full of electronics and audio manglers with no laptop in sight, Singularity is a one man performance that contains the punchy energy of the large show in a logistically easier package. 
Singularity also operates with an open stage concept. Members of the audience are free to come up and have a look at what is going on. Nothing is being hidden. Stand beside Fox as the music is coming to life. No barricades. Even setting up right in the middle of the floor has happened.
With punch, sweeping ambience, gut shaking bass and close up integration with the fans, this show shouldn't be missed.
(Take tribal drums, mix with pounding analogue synths and a killer club sound and what do you get? Welcome to iVardensphere. 

The new album, APOK, finds iVardensphere exploring different aspects of their sound, from dance floor stomping powernoise to more exotic flavors of tribal drumming blended with elements of trip-hop and a club-pleasing analog synth bumping EBM sound. APOK, iVardensphere's first release on Metropolis Records, also takes iVardensphere's passion for collaborations to a whole new level, bringing in guest artists including I:Scintilla, Caustic, God Module, and This Morn' Omina as well as featuring remixes by SKOLD, ESA, releveleR and Pull Out Kings.

The story of iVardensphere's rise begins a few years ago in Edmonton, Canada, where Scott Fox DJs the notorious club nights SICK and Das OOntz. Fox took his expertise in filling the dance floor and applied it to his passion for synths and industrial dance music to create a fresh take on the genre to form iVardensphere. Upon being heard for the first time by Vancouver-based label Synthetic Sounds, iVardensphere was immediately signed and the debut album Scatterface was released in July 2009, mastered by Sebastian Komor [Icon of Coil]. 

Soon after the completion of Scatterface, Scott enlisted the talents of Chris Lacroix [aka Siborg from Virtual Terrorist] to help bring the project from the studio to the stage, where the band shines. Ever since, iVardensphere has been constantly active live, having performed with acts ranging from Apoptygma Berzerk to Iszoloscope to 16Volt and Chemlab to Front Line Assembly at such places as Das Bunker in LA and the Kinetik Festival in Montreal. Buoyed by touring and word of mouth from an ever-growing fan base, iVardensphere has steadily swept across the industrial dance club scene in North America.

At the end of 2009, Scatterface made its way across the Atlantic on one of Europe’s leading darkrock and industrial labels, Danse Macabre Records, as Fox prepared iVardensphere's second release, Remixes Vol. 1, featuring remixes from Komor Kommando, Memmaker, Left Spine Down and others. Initially a digital-only release, fans demand CDs, and so Remixes vol. 1 came out in February 2010 on Synthetic Sounds. This release also marked iVardensphere's first introduction to the college radio charts across Canada. 

The summer of 2010 saw the band hit a wide range of cities and venues all across the USA and Canada with Iszoloscope and ad*ver*sary, gaining loads of new fans. Word of their powerful live shows continued to spread and they were asked to open Combichrist's North American tour in the fall of 2010, just in time for a new album to hit.

iVardensphere’s much anticipated second studio album, Bloodwater, came out in November of 2010, showcasing Fox's growing interest in using tribal drumming and other more organic sounds alongside electronics and samplers. Spurned on by club play and word of mouth from the band’s performances on Monsters on Tour with Combichrist, Bloodwater smouldered up the Canadian college radio electronic charts, eventually spending three months on !earshot’s national electronic charts in early 2011 and nine weeks on ChartAttack’s electronic charts. It also received great reviews, including in Outburn Magazine and Rue Morgue. 

The fall 2010 tour with Combichrist went so well that iVardensphere was asked to come out on tour with Combichrist again in the spring of 2011.

Wherever they roam, iVardensphere are always eager to collaborate with other artists, including working with Booming Tree Taiko on their first tour with Combichrist and trading remixes with the likes of Rotersand. Past collaborations with Iszoloscope went so well that iVardensphere recently announced that Iszoloscope's Yann Faussurier became a full-fledged member of iVardensphere at the end of 2010, and Fox, Faussurier and Lacroix wasted no time in starting work on APOK alongside their collaborators. iVardensphere recently grew again as Iszoloscope and Memmaker's Frédéric Scarfone also joined the fold as an official member after previously exchanging remixes with iVardensphere as Katastroslavia and co-writing on APOK.

The band's continuing growth and solid sounds caught the interest of industrial/electro powerhouse label Metropolis Records, who have now welcomed iVardensphere into the fold to help foster further expansion.)

REIN[FORCED]:

Rein[Forced] started in 2003 from the ashes of Pittsburgh based electro/industrial band Forced. Jim Semonik, aka Jimmy Semtex, was the only original member from the band left. Rather than breaking up, he decided to reboot the band while staying true to the sound of the first cd, Cherophobia(released on DSBP, 2002). Fellow local musicians D.A. Turner and Ben Bloom joined Semtex and decided that the second album would be a lot more personal. In early 2006, the second album, Futile Longings of a Condecending Man(DSBP, 2006) was released and Included the singles "Waster" and "Hiatus". The band also released a limited edition cdr entitled I Can't Be Responsible For Remixes under the original Forced name and sold it at shows. Cherophobia and Futile Longings are now sold out.

Following the release of Futile Longings, Rein[Forced] faced the loss of keyboardist, programmer, Ben Bloom. The band was devastated. The band took some time off and in 2007, started writing the follow up to Futile Longings, entitled X Amount Of Stabwounds In the Back. New songs "Nausea" and "Dichotomy" started to be included in live sets. However, as work continued on the new album, Semonik was diagnosed with stage 2B colorectal cancer and the album was placed on hold until he recovered. Semonik went through a harsh chemo/radiation treatment and almost died from a pancreatitis attack. During this time he compiled the Electronic Saviors:Industrial Music To Cure Cancer and released it on Metropolis Records in February of 2010. Rein[Forced] contributed a remix of new track "Malignancy". Semonik has also collaborated with Cleveland's Encoder, the U.K.'s Uberbyte and Pittsburgh's Prometheus Burning as well as Mindless Faith, Patricia Wake and a new side project called Borderlines.

In 2010, work resumed on X Amount, and got the attention of Chicago's WTII Records. Combining catchy synth hooks and coldwave inspired lyrics and attitude, Rein[Forced] provides a unique take on the current electo/industrial and EBM scene. Focusing more on song writing rather than club tracks that would be easily forgotten, Rein[Forced] provides a new depth to a style that has become forgotten in today's club scene while providing dancy grooves that will be remembered for years to come.

Dichotomy was released on April 3rd of 2012 and was the first single from the highly anticipated Rein[Forced] album "X Amount of Stab Wounds in the Back". This digital only single featured 6 versions of the title track including mixes by Stiff Valentine, Sensuous Enemy, Ego Likeness, Deathproof and The Dark Clan plus a special b-side

2013 saw the return of Rein[Forced] with the remix companion to last year's X Amount of Stab Wounds in the Back. Pre-existing Conditions is a 2xCD set that features 25 remixes and an unreleased b-side, a cover of Machines of Loving Grace's hit Butterfly Wings. Remixers for Pre-existing Conditions include Inertia, Society Burning, Stiff Valentine, Imperative Reaction, Die Sektor, Ego Likeness, I,Scintilla, Mindless Faith and many more.

Rein[Forced] has shared the stage with some heavy scene hitters such as Imperative Reaction, Aesthetic Perfection, Pigface, Hanzel Und Gretyl, Bella Morte, Ego Likeness, Celldweller, Funker Vogt, Haujobb, Assemblage 23, Project Pitchfork, Chemlab, Terrorfakt, Acumen Nation, Interface, My Life With the Thrill Kill Kult and Chris Connelly. Semonik has also appeared on recent releases by The Dark Clan and Sonik Foundry. Stay tuned, there is much more to come.

CRYOGEN SECOND:
Hailing all the way from Nashville, industrial/electro outfit,Cryogen Second is a powerful entry to the world of dark electronics. Featuring Eric Sochocki ( All Studio programming and vocals) Kevin Edlin (live guitars) and Asli Tiner (Live Synths), Cryogen Second's 2011 full length "Anthem for the Great Self Destruct" on Beyond Therapy records contained crunchy synthetic loops, heavy-hitting hooks, slick production, and nods to modern metal that are contained in each track, with lyrics that evoke fatalism and a ponderence on the very futility that dominates the human condition. Probably best known for their club track "Clarity" which first saw the light of day in 2010 , and can be found with remixes from Metropolis recording artist, Caustic and also Level 2.0 on the self-released Clarity EP

But Cryogen Second is a completely different beast live. While the album and EP'S are riddled with influences from bands like Meshuggah, Fear Factory, The Deftones, Pneumatic Detach, Prodigy, and Psyclon Nine, the live presentation becomes the sum of these parts, incorporating live guitars, synthesizers, and showmanship into a frenetic performance that is more reminiscent of the energy of a late 90's punk show than a modern dance outfit. This band has shared the stage with both metal and electronic bands such as Assemblage 23, Faderhead, FGFC820, Bella Morte, Ludovico Technique, Common Man Down, God Module, Espermachine, Angels on Acid, Ego Likeness and could be just as easily at home in a mosh pit or a dance floor, often bridging the two disparate influences in the same song.

Cryogen Second are also gaining a strong reputation for their solid remixes, having just completed deconstructing songs by Caustic, Inure, Level 2.0, Stahlnebel and WTII Records very own, State of the Union!

STANDARD ISSUE CITIZEN:
Standard Issue Citizen has been leaving its mark across the northeast and midwest US since 2007. Originally a project of frontman Tim Mizerak, the band has since grown to become a full-fledged act.

They have shared the stage with many great industrial acts including Aesthetic Perfection, Nachtmahr, The Ludovico Technique, Psyclon Nine, Dawn of Ashes, Hanzel und Gretyl, Slick Idiot, Mankind Is Obsolete, Espermachine, and more!

Their first CD, Your Opinion Is Forfeit, was released in December 2010. It features a collection of the band's early works and was mixed by Isaac Glendening of Cesium_137. It was soon followed by the free SICfuck EP in 2011.

In 2012, the band embarked on their first tour of both the northeast and midwest regions of the United States and released a new single "Superhero" featuring remixes from numerous rising talents in the industrial scene.

Now, in 2014, Standard Issue Citizen has been selected to be a part of Electronic Saviors: Industrial Music to Cure Cancer Volume 3 and will continue playing shows all over the US as they prepare to release their next album, due late Summer 2014.

New single "Signals of Distress" out 4.15.2014! Download the Superhero single and SICfuck EP for FREE from standardissuecitizen.com!

SERVITOR:
Servitor reflects the living resurrected earth springing back through the decay of the failed industrial machine of many cities. The living breathing pulsing drums, the grinding, rhythmic machine of industry.
Members-Servitor

Sound-Servitor combines live percussion with foundations in traditional West African, Afro Cuban, Middle Eastern, Brazilian, and American tribal drums with a heavy, diverse and rich background of grinding industrial programming. A screaming, pulsing, thundering, music experience that is a massive departure from the usual approach to rhythms in electronic music.
Live Servitor’s unique setup and approach allows for performances along with other artists. Servitor has performed live with dancers and has played drums for other acts. Servitor’s music has been used for fusion/bellydance performance tracks poi/fire performances and independent commercial advertisements. The best way to get the live feel of Servitor’s drums in a dance/fire performance is to bring Servitor and the drums on stage.

Followers- Servitor’s unique sound, and heavy emphasis on drums has thundered through the underworld to bring out the most unexpected, but entirely welcome cadre of dancers, artists and misfits. Among the masses of Servitor dendrophants are the raq-ing, shimmy-ing belly dancer, the vintage-teching steampunk, the boot-stomping rivethead, the drum circling skin pounders, the footloose African dancer, Ren Faire geeks and SCA enthusiasts. The audience of a Servitor show is always diverse and overflowing with creative, artistic minds. It’s impossible not to fit in.

265824153594962.description:
18. juli kommer selveste Chicago til Langesund!

Hør for deg allsangen:

“You’re the meaning in my life – You’re the inspiration – You bring feeling to my life – You’re the inspiration”

Nå kan du klype deg i armen og se om du drømmer. Denne sommeren gjør du faktisk Ikke det, for selveste CHICAGO kommer til Langesund og Wrightegaarden!

Vi snakker om bandet som av eks-president Bill Clinton ble omtalt som det viktigste bandet siden de fant opp rock n roll. Bandet som er det eneste amerikanske bandet som har vært på topp 40 listene over beste album i seks tiår på rad. Ja, akkurat det Chicago er det vi snakker om.

For godt til å være sant sier du? Nei da. Som eneste norske konsertscene tar vi i mot Chicago i sommer, og vi gjør det forhåpentligvis for en stappfull Wrightegaarden-hage.

Chicago består fortsatt av medlemmer fra den originale besetningen som Robert Lamm, Lee Loughnane, James Pankow og Walt Parazaider. Med seg i bandet har de også Jason Scheff, Tris Imboden, Keith Howland, Lou Pardini og Wally Reyes. Dette er bandets 46 år på rad med turneer, og de har fortsatt ikke utsatt en eneste konsertdato. Det må vel også være en eller annen form for rekord?

Vi klarer nesten ikke sitte stille når vi tenker på at slagere som If you leave me now, You´re the inspiration, Hard to say i´m sorry og Saturday in the park, i tillegg til flere slagere og en rekke helt nye låter, vil ljome utover hagen og Langesund fredag 18. juli.
265824153594962.name: Chicago - Wrightegaarden

To launch our new show What's Up with Those Beards?, Boom Chicago will do a Guiness World Record attempt on Wednesday March 26. Under supervision of the Guinness Book, we hope to assemble 500 men with a beard at Boom Chicago’s theater on the Rozengracht. The event is organized in support for Sta Op Tegen Kanker to create awareness for this action platform of KWF.

DON'T JUST CLICK 'GOING' - PLEASE SIGN UP...!
>>www.boomchicago.nl/world-record

THE PROGRAM WEDNESDAY MARCH 26
 
*At 18:00 our Beard Bitches welcome you and measure the length of your beard.
>> An overnight shadow doesn’t count. A beard takes at least a week! 

*Our DJ plays some great tunes in our Bar117 while the Jaegerettes treat you to a free shot of Jaegermeister.

*At 18:30 we want to take a 360 degree photo of you and 499 other men with beards in our theater. 
>> Be in the Guinness Book Of World Records! 

*We will also hand out two awards, one for the most creative Beard and one for the Longest Beard. 
>> The specialists of debaard.nl will be the judge of this

*The winners will get VIP tickets to the Premiere of Whats Up with Those Beards?, as well as a year long free entrance to Boom Chicago’s shows and on behalf of the winners we will support Sta op Tegen Kanker with a year long donarship.

*All participants get a free ticket to the preview of Boom Chicago’s new show What’s Up with Those Beards? on March 26, 27, 28 or 29 end a give away.

273578552804827.description:
Friends of Food He.ro,

Great News! Our project has been selected by Seed Chicago, the city’s curated Kickstarter page for projects specifically focusing on job creation and growth in Chicago’s neighborhoods. A major benefit to being selected to Seed Chicago is our project will receive greater exposure, increasing our ability to meet our funding goals. 

Food He.ro (www.foodhe.ro) is social enterprise established as a food tech lab/incubator with a social mission to assist food businesses and food tech startups with education and training. FoodHe.ro's vision is to be at the forefront of innovation with cutting edge tools, resources, technology,and a kitchen lab for food innovators, entrepreneurs, and industry professionals.

To learn more about our project, visit our project page and watch our video at http://kck.st/1epo73j 

Also, we’re asking for your help in sharing the above Kickstarter link on your social sites or make a pledge. Pledges will only be received if you successfully reach our campaign goal. 

To learn more about Seed Chicago, visit Seed Chicago (www.SeedChicago.net ). Thanks for your support.

Sincerely,

Javier Haro  &  Juan Saldana
