ABOUT TIGA
2007 – Present, “Ciao Means Forever”
Sometime in 2007, Tiga achieved Full Online Consciousness. This has given him the ability to speak directly to you through the computer, a miracle you will only now come to fully appreciate:

My Name Is Tiga. Welcome to the Bio-Dome, mec!

As you know, my remix work has slowed considerably as of late. While my versions of tracks by Alter Ego, New Young Pony Club, The Gossip and Human League have only enhanced my reputation as the Sex Whiz of Sonic Parkour, I felt I needed to start hoarding my best ideas for my own music. The remix of Alter Ego’s “Gary”, for instance, forced me to cannibalize much of the work I’d done in my now-legendary sessions with Bobby McFerrin. It was then that I knew that I had to draw the line.

The seeds for ZZT, my ongoing collaboration with Zombie Nation, when we hit it off at the semi-biannual Gigolo High-Earners Galmour Pageant and Hot Meal. After falling out with Gigolo over accusations of cyber-arson, I approached him about working together, possibly on music. I soon came to love his thing-throwing, humor-having ways. Our tracks tend to be “live” in nature, in that we try to only use parts that require four hands at a time. Or 19 fingers and three lips. It depends.

Rainier Werner Bassfinder takes everything great about my work with Jesper Dahlback and takes it to a new level. One that forces me to use a fake name. I chose the moniker “The Dove” for reasons contractual and shame-based. Probably 70/30, contract/shame. Oh, Michael Gothard, I only wanted to do right by you!

Over the past few years, I have continued to tour the globe extensively. I have eaten Club Sandwiches in over 60 countries and done “The Sandwich” in over 600 clubs. I was also brave enough to visit the Middle East, with a harrowing trip to war-ravaged Dubai. I was taken falconing (this is 100 percent true), which was strange enough before I found out that the falcons undergo extensive plastic surgery to look more like celebrities. My falcon, I was told, was supposed to resemble Ethan Hawke. I don’t know who that is.

The past few years have also seen a resurgence at my record label, Turbo. The work done by Thomas Von Party in A&R and Oliver Interactive in International Business Affairs has been invaluable. I can’t express how much I appreciate their efforts in making Turbo the Towerhorse it is today. I would be remiss, however, in not mentioning the real star of the show, our Branding Consultant, Brandon Branding.

Brandon saw ways of expanding our brand in new and exciting directions. He insisted I start participating in community soccer leagues to lend an “everyman” quality to my daunting brilliance. I was skeptical at first, but soon I came to treasure seeing the faces of 50-year-old men in goggles light up as I take the field. I am a defense-minded, vaguely passive-aggressive midfielder, and have trained online with Ghana international Michael Essien.

Mr. Branding also encouraged me to write for the label, birthing a torrid run of press sheets that has sparked in me a love of letters deep and true. Now I write all the time. I even replaced my car’s paneling with dry-erase board, so that I may lean out the driver’s seat window at a moment’s notice to scrawl away at the face of literature.

Today, our reach extends even further, thanks to my venturing into the world of amateur inventing. There’s the Grocery Claw, aimed at those who rightly abhor what I call Market Filth. And, with an eye towards the future of our planet, Solar-Powered Wind.

Most importantly, 2009 will see the release of my new LP, “Ciao!” This album will surely cement my status as a Storytella and Funky Fella. “Ciao!” is the fruit of 15 months of collaborations with such leading lights as Soulwax, Jesper Dahlback, Gonzales, Jori Hulkonnen, Jake Shears and James Murphy. An impressive roster, to say the least. What was that? What do you mean, “What?” That sound you just made! It was like a snort, a dismissive snort. have you worked with, then, genius? Sting Jr.? That weirdo form Simply Red? Lady Sting? I am not impressed in the least.

All in all, at the end of the day, I can’t help but gaze into the reflecting pool and think to myself, “I guess I really turned the night on, huh?”

1976 – 2003, “The Creation Myth”
“The citizen may take a bride, but it is the rifleman who takes a lover. Ultimately we all must choose either the myth or the mountain.”

The origins of Montreal born DJ-producer-incipient Teutonic legend Tiga lie to the vague and troubling East, where he was weaned on the nefarious milk of the notorious 1980s Indian club scene.“To the unforgiving eye,” he says of the sybaritic night-kingdom,“a world of filth and decadence is revealed. For example, I’m fairly certain that more than a few club owners had an unsavory arrangement with the man who brought the folding chairs. I was at once appalled and enraptured. After that, I had no choice in the matter.”

By 1990, Tiga had returned to Montreal, prodigiously nightwise and unsatisfied with the existing local club scene (calling it “the plumage of a bird I cannot bring myself to want.”) With the help of a core group of friends, he began to throw a series of small parties infused with the sense of dead-eyed ennui gleaned from a past littered with acid whores and crazed Indian gamblers. Other innovations which Tiga introduced to Montreal party culture include guest DJs, intense street promotions featuring rival gangs of street acrobats, color flyers, multi-dj sets, and leading the supplicant crowd through the innermost corridors of one’s soul.

It was this heady time of dizzying innovation and ravenous sexual ambition, which culminated in the birth of 1993’s “Solstice,” generally, considered to be Montreal’s first genuine rave. (A year earlier, a hyper-prescient Tiga staged “Eclectricity,” the first online rave, a project whose utter failure remains a source of bafflement: “It broke my heart, given my views on diversity . . . I am, I feel, a very interactive person.”) Tiga has since helped to orchestrate no less than ten major events, including “The Orb Live,” “Pure,” and the very first North American appearance of continental illusionist Jean-There.

In 1994, Tiga bought DNA Records, a small medical data concern, and parlayed it into Montreal’s premiere electronic music boutique. “We’ve always believed in putting the customer first, from helping you find that one minimal house record that will make your collection to offering concerned looks as you wade through the enormous backlog of test results to discover if you are in fact afflicted with a congenital disease.”

In 1996, Tiga privately sang about the death of actor and poet Tupac Shakur.
That same year, the Montreal dance community found a haven for the boldest feats of dance, where fools are in love with mystery and sex-valor is prized above all else. Sona (meaning literally ‘Liar-dancer’) was initially conceived of by Tiga and his two partners as “a perverse, jeering monolith, because nothing is sacred anymore” but it has evolved into much more. In addition to its place among the pantheon of urban groove centers, on weekdays it rents out its facilities, at a very reasonable rate, to a local program dedicated to teaching homeless men to dance properly (“I just think it’s an important project,” Tiga said at the time).

In 1998, Tiga started Turbo Recordings as an outlet for his wildman organ escapades but he soon found a host of other artists who were willing to be paid to record for him. Turbo has released over 20 albums, 2 samplers, and 12 vinyl twelve inches as well as secured global distribution with Prime, Intergroove and Caroline. Notable releases include Peter Benisch’s “Soundtrack Saga,” Christopher Handlebar’s “To a Time of Asia” and Tiga’s own “Mixed Emotions” and “American Gigolo”

By 2001, however, overwork and media saturation began to show their strain, as evidenced by Tiga’s hysterical outburst at a fashion photographer during a promo shoot:

“I’ll sit for your venal cigarette pictures, but I will not indulge you in your game of ‘Eyes! Lies! Surprise!’ I dare you, coward—call out your cloakmen! What are you waiting for? The truth?!”

Following a month spent riding horses and caring for his voice, Tiga entered the studio with producer Zyntherius “Jori” Hulkonnen and a singular vision: “electro, but mainly about my eyes.” The result, a searing rendition of his former Mother Mio bandmate Corey Hart’s solo smash “Sunglasses at Night,” challenged dancers and seduced critics alike, yet Tiga is coy when asked about its impact, particularly in Germany: “’Sunglasses’ is a sinless child, a gleaming medallion. But is also a trick, a trick of memory. You must understand – on a whim, we revealed the hidden fire of Europe.”

But fires need tending and lumber. And so the onslaught of Tiga-powered releases was fated to continue. They are his craft, his life, his living craft-fire.

“We live in the Age of Cruelty and every day I struggle to find my place in it. All I know I can offer the world is a thousand more adventures through dancing and light.”

2003 – 2006, “Get on Top of the Fire”
If “Sunglasses at Night” marked Tiga’s coronation as the steely Wolf-King of Dance Mountain, then his subsequent remixes for the likes of Martini Bros., Alpinestars, Linda Lamb, Crossover, FC Kahuna, Cabaret Voltaire, Telepopmusik, Felix da Housecat, Fischerspooner, FPU, The Devils (Nick Rhodes), and Danni Minogue birthed his dewy-eyed heir, Darian. Says Tiga, “I have also produced remixes for City Rockers, and singles for Turbo Recordings, Intec, Drumcode, and Electrix with Mateo Murphy under the name TGV. I am also the hidden hero of the ongoing NHL lockout. I will break the players’ will – you have my solemn word.”

In 2003, Tiga took his conqueror’s tools to the streets, with a heralded mix CD for !K7’s DJ Kicks series, and an ethereal reading of Nelly’s “Hot in Herre,” which became a stalwart success and was subsequently licensed in the UK by Skint (in the UK) and Warner Music (the GAS region). The video, which can be seen at http://www.eyeballnyc.com/tiga, is a revelation of neo-urban dazzle-do, courtesy of the puppet wizardry of Tiga’s brother, the Lord of the Marionette (www.lordofthemarionette.com).

Tiga was also gracious enough to lend his wind-shattering vocals to Richard X’s “You (Better Let Me Love YouX4) Tonight,” as well as “Heartbreak/Ananda,” by Beyer & Lenk (Adam Beyer and Jesper Dahlback), and Rik Stamina’s “Dancing Inside You.” His remix work on Alex Kidd’s “Come With Me”, Neon Judgement’s “TV Treated,” Scissor Sisters’ cover of Pink Floyd’s “Comfortably Numb,” “Da Hype,” by Junior Jack and Robert Smith, and Peaches’ “Shake Yer Dix,” and Soulwax’s “E Talking” comprises a merciless Crimson Romance, lapping at the shores of eternity.

Tiga’s smash single “Pleasure From The Bass”, a two-fisted jackal that drew a line in the dancefloor sand, was released in 2004 on the Belgian imprint PIAS.

2005 saw remixes for Depeche Mode, The Vests, Moby, LCD Soundsystem, Mylo, Phillipe Zdar, Chelonius Jones, Drama Society, Thomas Andersson and countless others. In October, Tiga womanized the world with “You Gonna Want Me”, his toothsome duet with Jake Shears (of Scissor Sisters’ fame), “Once again, I proved you can’t spell ‘sword’ without ‘words’” says the dance-freckled Disco Jockler.

2006 began with the release of Tiga’s debut album Sexor, which sounded the clarion call of an emergent Nation-Man. “It is an exhilarating time – the woes and the whoas, the thrills and the throes! Like Icarus, I have flown dangerously close to the fun, on a dare to wear my overalls undone.”
Tiga then embarked on the “Sexor over Europe” and “Sexor over Canada” tours in a manner befitting The Most Compassionate Man Alive. “Soon I will position Sexor over America and Sexor over Japan, forcing rapt smiles onto the faces of the discovantaged, those fey, oblivious costumers’ sons…”, he said.

That same year, Tiga made you go “Tig-unnggghh!” with the video for the single, “(Far From) Home.” Shot in Tokyo, the clip follows Tiga on a soul-laughening journey down a street of some sort. The video was helmed by Nagi Noda, the accalimed Japanese director of the groundbreaking music video for Yuki’s “Sentimental Journey”, a short film, Ex Fat Girl, which features exercising poodles, and projects for Nike and Laforet, for which she has won a host of prizes in Japan, not the least of which being Tiga’s coveted “Admiration-in-Japan” Medal.

Meanwhile, the “(Far From) Home” single left mankind fitted for underjeans, provocatively asking listeners “Are you a DoJ or a Don’tJ?” The release included remix work by the DFA, Digitalism, and Chicken Lips, showcasing Tiga’s incredibly exotic voice in new sonic locales, as well as a remix by Tiga himself, “The Speed of Sexor Reprise.” A well-meaning dub edit by Jon Aerosmith & Eduardo B. Rich was politely declined.

Tiga’s reign of wonder continued to not stop, as he dutifully drew up the dance contracts for tracks by Coldcut and Pet Shop Boys. “As both a student – and a significant part – of history, I feel it would be a betrayal of my stewardship to ever remix music in anger. It is not the Way of the Musician, nor is it the Musician’s Way.”


ABOUT GREEN VELVET
Change has been a constant theme throughout the successful career of Green Velvet, but as he has crossed genres, explored themes from the comedic to the serious and changed monikers, the common thread running through the music he has made for nearly two decades is its roots in and dedication to the Chicago House sound.

His first transformation came when he left master’s degree studies in chemical engineering at UC-Berkeley to turn a hobby into a career making music, influenced by the sounds he had been exposed to as a science-fiction-loving, video-game-playing kid whose father was a part-time Chicago DJ.

As Cajmere, he released his inaugural Underground Goodies EP in 1991 on his Cajual label, keeping true to the early House sound. He quickly followed it up the next year with the smash hit “Coffeepot (It’s Time for the Percolator).”

Not one to rest on his success, he soon changed things up, teaming with vocalist Dajae for “Brighter Days,” a more mellow House tune, this one released by Emotive. That pairing would be his last with a female vocalist until his recent partnership with rapper Kid Sister for “Everybody Wants.”

The 17 years in between those two projects witnessed an incredible array of electronic music emanating from this prolific artist, as well as a second label under his direction, Relief. Adopting the persona Green Velvet (not to mention a Day-Glo shock wig) for his techno-oriented pieces and DJ appearances, he became the champion of new wave Chicago beats through the ’90s-known best for hits such as “Preacher Man,” “Flash” (a No. 1 U.S. dance hit in 1995), and 1997′s laugh-inducing “Answering Machine.” The decade ended with his first album, Constant Chaos in 1999.

The new century brought a compilation album, Green Velvet, during a brief signing with Warner Bros. Records’ short-lived F-111 imprint, and a production album, Whatever, on Relief. The punk-inspired Whatever explored darker themes than his previous work, including racism (“When?”), drug use (“Genedefekt” and “La La Land”), alienation (“Sleepwalking”) and bending to authority (“Gat”).

“La La Land” went on to become by far the biggest selling track of his career. His live act expanded as he began playing a keytar, with two other musicians-Nazuk and Spaceboy-backing him, playing heavily distorted synths.

The last decade also saw Green Velvet become a fan favorite across Europe, playing to huge crowds at festivals in addition to live radio appearances and club gigs. Numerous side projects and remixes under various names also added to his seemingly nonstop musical output.
In 2005, Green Velvet released his third album, Walk In Love, which stayed true to the House sound, with a few pop- and punk-oriented tracks for good measure, including “Come Back” and “Pin-Up Girl,” both of which featured a live guitarist.

The ongoing evolution in the music, career and life of the artist born Curtis Alan Jones in Chicago has been and will continue to be fascinating to watch and experience for his many followers.

Over the past seven year’s Green Velvet has released some of his most beloved anthems, including “Shake and Pop”, “Everybody Wants”, “Milli Vanilli”. Riding the wave of critical acclaim and success, Green Velvet has been touring the globe stopping at some of the most respected clubs and festivals along way.

In addition to his solo work, he has been collaborating with some of underground dance music’s most respected and popular producers, including Maceo Plex, Jamie Jones, Danny Tenaglia, Pleasurekraft, Phil Kieran, Carl Craig, Derrick Carter, Crookers and DJ Sneak.

The 2014 Chicago Palestine Film Festival is here!  April 19th - May 1st at Gene Siskel Film Center of the School of the Art Institute of Chicago and 1 night at Moraine Valley Community College on April 27th!

Opening Night is Saturday April 19th, kicking off with a red carpet premiere, food, Palestinian-inspired sweets, raffle, and more, 2014 Oscar nominated film OMAR, then ending the night with a Skype audience discussion with OMAR director Hany Abu Assad!

We have a great film lineup this year!  FYI, your ticket purchase is for both films, they come together, one is a short film, the other the full film:   

OMAR (and MAQLOUBEH) @Gene Siskel Film Center
Saturday, April 19, 8:00 pm
Wednesday, April 23, 8:15 pm

Wednesday, April 30, 8:00 pm

Tuesday, April 29, 8:15 pm

JUST PLAY (and APARTMENT 10/14) @Moraine Valley Community College
Sunday, April 27th, 3:00pm

Click on the link below for more information:
http://palestinefilmfest.com/films-2/


We hope to see you there!

351750344965818.description:
ATTENTION MIDWEST GREEKS!!!!

THE 2014 CHICAGO GREEK WEEKEND COMMITTEE BRINGS YOU….

THE CHICAGO - ATLANTA GREEK PICNIC PARTY BUS | THURS JUNE 5-SUNDAY JUNE 9

http://chigreekbustrip.eventbrite.com/
http://chigreekbustrip.eventbrite.com/
http://chigreekbustrip.eventbrite.com/
 
Visit http://AtlantaGreekPicnic.com for AGP Details and http://chicagogreekbustrip.eventbrite.com/ to reserve your seat on the CGW bus!
 
On behalf of the Chicago Greek Weekend Committee I cordially invite you to take part in Chicago Atlanta Greek Picnic Invasion. Wednesday Night June 4th our coach bus will depart Chicago enroute to this year’s 2014 Atlanta Greek Picnic. This will be a weekend packed with festivities, parties, the Atlanta Greek Picnic, fellowship, and much more.
This year we are doing it bigger and better as seats fill up rather quickly and we expect even more participation this year. We have coordinated with the chair of the AGP to ensure that the trip will be a special time for all who are fortunate enough to join us.
 
Financial Obligations:
• $155 for bus travel (All persons will be picked up at one location in
Chicago on Chicago St. University’s Campus or a college campus
depending on your geographic location and returned there Sunday
evening)
• $109 for hotel stay for 3 days (rate quoted at 3 per bedroom. This rate will be smaller if you plan to have more than 3 in a room per night) All persons are responsible for booking their own hotels and can do so  here.
• In order to reserve your seat a $75 deposit is due.  We sell ever year so be sure to put your deposit down before the bus fills up. 
We will likely have 2 buses this year if the demand is there. 
 
Benefits:
• In addition to the clear economic advantage of paying  about $250 for travel and hotel (which you will book on your own)
The bus will take us to and pick us from all events and will make any stops that the group would like to make as a whole
Departure/Pick Up Times and Locations:
We will be departing from Chicago, IL June 4 at approximately 10PM
from the Campus of Chicago State University (9501 S. King Dr) and be
arriving back to Chicago on June 8, 2014 in the evening. We will be able to
stop in Central Illinois and Southern Illinois to accommodate riders who are
on campus and details for those pickup locations are forthcoming.
 
Email ChiGreekWeekend@gmail.com for more details

Have questions about Chicago Greek Weekend Atlanta Greek Picnic Bus Trip 2014? 

Contact CHiCAGO GREEK WEEKEND

372335232908030.description:
Incorrect Music & Paradigm Underground Present

THE INCORRECT MUSIC LOFT PARTY
featuring 

ANTHONY ATTALLA
COCODRILLS
w/ special guest Dustin Sheridan 

Saturday, April 5th 
Location TBA ~ Chicago, IL
Doors at 12 midnight

Advance tickets highly recommended, space is limited:
www.wantickets.com/incorrectchicagoLOFT

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Incorrect Music frontman Anthony Attalla teams up with the Paradigm crew to bring the sound back underground, featuring 7+ hours of proper house showcased in an off-site loft space.  Along with Attalla, Space Miami residents Cocodrills will be flying up from South Beach to make a special appearance in the Windy City.  Opening the night is Chicago favorite and Spybar resident, Dustin Sheridan.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

ANTHONY ATTALLA
Incorrect Music // Chicago, IL

As we enter 2014, Anthony Attalla has firmly established himself as a rising star in the electronic music community.  His personal growth in the studio as a producer and on stage as a performer has the industries biggest taste makers, as well as its biggest publications, proclaiming that Anthony is set to break out in the coming year.  Never resting on his laurels, Anthony has also demonstrated his passion for the business side of the industry by creating a platform to showcase his favorite talent through Incorrect Music, his music production-company, which has proven to be a most successful endeavor.  

As an artist, Anthony has charted over 50 Top 100 tracks on Beatport.com, the widely popular outlet for purchasing Dance Music.  With popular labels such as Sony, Atlantic, Warner Bros, Ultra, and Toolroom seeking his productions as well as underground heavyweights Suara, Great Stuff, 1605, Trapez, Tronic, Break New Soil, MBF, and Stereo Recordings, Attalla has become a wanted man.  In addition, the demand for his live performance has grown to an all-time high with continuous touring throughout the United States, as well as international bookings in Europe, Ibiza, Mexico & Latin America, Asia, the Middle East and Canada.  Furthermore, Anthony made his mark this summer on the White Isle (Ibiza, Spain) as he was asked to support Axwell and Sebastian Ingrosso on their newly formed 'Departures' project.  The residency at the uber exclusive Ushuaia Hotel & Pool showcased the world's most in-demand talent and is arguably Ibiza's hottest ticket.

Now surpassing its three-year anniversary, Incorrect Music has experienced success at an alarming pace.  The label’s achievements include having tracks played and charted by some of the industries’ most credible artists, boasting over 70 Top 100 tracks on various Beatport Charts, and spreading its wings globally with artists from more than 20 different countries making up its impressive roster.

With Anthony’s multi-faceted approach to an increasingly demanding industry, he illustrates his ability to evolve and achieve as he continues to make his meteoric rise in international dance scene.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

COCODRILLS
Incorrect Music // Miami, FL

Where they're from or how they grew up is entirely irrelevant. When they started off and what their influences were are inconsequential. Listing the popular venues they've played or name dropping artist that support them would be disingenuous. This is because a short anecdotal paragraph loaded with DJ/producer cliches wouldn't do their style, or their sound, any justice. The Cocodrills (Christian "Pridef" Diaz, Adam Cruz) pride themselves on creating a unique musical experience, which can only be just that; experienced. But make sure to leave your pretense at the door 'cause you won't find any bullshit at one of their parties; only funky grooves, positive vibes and rampant debauchery. And while they don't claim to have reinvented the wheel, they do like to take that wheel down the road of sound for a ride so wild it wakes up the next morning with no tread smelling of burnt rubber and a wondrous sense of "let's do that again!". Act accordingly.
372335232908030.name: Incorrect Music & Paradigm Underground Present... The Incorrect Music Loft Party (Chicago)

424068137726096.description:
The Flow Show 2014
Flow Arts Showcase Coming to Chicago

Save the Dates:
March 28th - 30th

Doors at 7:00pm Show at 8:00pm

TICKETS ON SALE NOW!!

https://www.vendini.com/ticket-software.html?t=tix&e=d25c8ce4fff893d6f877681a9be29cc6

We proudly announce that the Flow Show, a showcase of some of the country's best talent in the flow arts, will be coming to Chicago in 2014! Chicago is honored to be the third city selected for this intimate celebration of movement and community. As proved in other cities, this two night spectacle of object manipulation and technical dance composition is certain to leave a memorable impression on the Windy City.

Flow Show Chicago will take place at Studio 773, a recently renovated theatre with black box elegance of draped curtains and modern architecture. The venue is located one mile west of Lake Michigan and is conveniently nestled within unique dining and shopping experiences. 

The Flow Show anticipates a delightful evening. Since it's birth in San Francisco, 2009, the Flow Show has been met with consistently sold out performances and rave reviews, providing audiences with inspiration and excitement for a growing art form. 

Flow arts communities across the country, from San Francisco to Brooklyn, New York are teaming with creativity and talent, each with their own unique local flair. The Midwest, too, is home to a thriving community of object manipulation enthusiasts and performers. It is only natural that Flow Show Chicago 2014 is born. With only 150 seats available at Studio 773, Chicago anticipates a full house.

www.theflowshow.org

TICKETS ON SALE NOW!!
https://www.vendini.com/ticket-software.html?t=tix&e=d25c8ce4fff893d6f877681a9be29cc6
424068137726096.name: Flow Show Chicago 2014 - March 28 -30th

441956489240062.description:
Hi friends!

I'm writing to invite you to the annual Casino Night fundraiser I've helped coordinate to benefit the Epilepsy Foundation of Greater Chicago Peer Alliance, a board formed in 2013 that I serve as co-President. 

Peer Alliance is a city-based program in Chicago, and we are dedicated to providing support for adults ages 18-35 affected by epilepsy. Our free programs create a safe community for individuals to come together as they enter new challenges of adulthood with epilepsy. Our mission is simple: no one should stand alone.

Having struggled with epilepsy since the age of 7, I look back and wish there had been times in my rocky journey in which I could've related to someone going through a similar experience. This is why we are here and have created something lacking in the Chicago community. I am proud to be a part of this effort. 

Here is the link to purchase tickets or donate to the event. We do have an early bird ticket price that ends today so grab 'em now!! 

http://epilepsychicago.donordrive.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=donorDrive.event&eventID=554 

The early bird ticket price of $75 ($85 regular beginning March 13) includes heavy appetizers, beer, wine and a signature cocktail, dancing, DJ, "fake" gambling money and some awesome raffles to bid on. Come dressed in cocktail attire, ready for a red carpet photo opp! 

If you have questions, msg me or email at msultemeier@epilepsychicago.org 

Thank you for your support. 

Love,
Maria
441956489240062.name: Casino Night - Epilepsy Foundation of Greater Chicago!

The Fine Arts faculty and Portfolio Center at Columbia College are proud to present the third annual Fine Arts Open Studios, featuring afternoon critiques and a festive studio open house designed to showcase the studio practices and working methodologies of our Senior BFA students. Guests are invited to provide feedback on work-in-progress that will culminate in a thesis exhibition later this Spring, and enjoy fellowship with students, faculty, and alumni in our vibrant studio complex.

Participating artists include: Sarah Colbert, Kiana Englehaupt, Traci Fowler, Jesus Hernandez, Lauren Nicole Iacoponi, Alexandra Maistros, Max Schif, Jeremy William Steffen, Brandon Studer, Cristabel Tapia, Diana Zabielaite, Monica Pizano, Marija Ratkeviciute, Trevor Schmutz, and Donna Skonning. 

This event is part of Industry Events 2014, Columbia's annual showcase series introducing emerging talent to professional creative communities. See the full schedule at colum.edu/industryevents, running now through May 15.

508124512604846.description:
This documentary tells the story of Judi Bari, Daryl Cherney and others that were working to prevent logging of old growth forests by organizing with loggers and by using non-violent direct action. 

The documentary explores and the mystery behind the bombing of her car with both she and fellow Earth Firster, Daryl Cherney inside. 

This documentary will be followed by a discussion of themes and topics covered in the film  including government/state repression of activist organizations and what we can learn from the struggles of activists who have come before before us.

It would be great if you could bring a few dollars to give to support the organizations hosting the event. 

Rising Tide Chicago. Chicago IWW, Multi Kulti

http://www.whobombedjudibari.com/
http://risingtidenorthamerica.org

521158114671805.description:
Gallery13 : 'The Thaw' 

'GOMEZ/ GONZALEZ' 

Exhibition Hours: Tues. - Sat. : Noon - 6pm 
Sat. April 5th - Sat. May24th 2014 

Fresh from Chicago and  33 Art Center at the Zhou B. 

MUSIC: DJ SOL SUPREME 
https://www.facebook.com/dj.so.supreme.mpls

SPONSOR 
PBR


Mario Gonzalez 
http://www.mariogonzalezjr.com/

Sergio Gomez
http://www.sergiogomezonline.com/o Gonzalez 

Zhou b Art Center, Chicago 
http://www.zhoubartcenter.com/



Bio 
Mario Gonzalez 
http://www.mariogonzalezjr.com/

 Mario Gonzalez come to Gallery13 fresh from a 64-day world tour which began with an artist in residence in Gwangju, South Korea that included a two person exhibition. Following a month stay in South Korea, Mario was invited to return for a solo exhibition as well as participation in the Gwangju Biennial 2014. He was sponsored by the US Consulate to represent Chicago in the International Meeting of Styles in Wiesbaden, Germany this summer and also received an 

Mario Gonzalez has traveled the globe  painting subways, murals, performing, teaching and showing works in galleries and museums "searching for the perfect beat" which he had always carried all along.

In 2002, he started painting smaller works that he called "Graffpop" because Graffiti was a mainstream art phenomenon. 

t Mario began painting in larger scale while opening a studio at the Zhou B Art Center in Chicago. In his new studio and surrounded by a vibrant art community, Mario fused all the elements that he had experienced over the years such as pouring, dripping, drawing and using non-traditional techniques and processes. These new approach culminated into a style of urban abstract graffiti and expressionism that is now highly acclaimed by local and international galleries and museums.


Bio 
Sergio Gomez
http://www.sergiogomezonline.com/

Sergio Gomez is the Director of Exhibitions at the Zhou B. Art Center, owner & director of 33 Contemporary Gallery, contributor for Italia Arte Magazine, founder of VisualArtToday.com; a curated online exhibition space for international contemporary art. In addition, Sergio is an accomplished graphic designer, Art/Design faculty at South Suburban College, Creative Consultant for Idea Seat Marketing and Advertising and co-founder of 3C Wear LLC.

Sergio has organized numerous important exhibitions such as “The National Self-Portrait Exhibition”, “Get Real: New Figurative Realism in Chicago” “CelebrARTE”, “Chicago’s Twelve”, “Chicago’s Twelve at Garfield Park Conservatory”, “Style Bombing” 

Sergio’s work has been subject of solo exhibitions in the United States, Italy and Vienna. He has participated in numerous group exhibitions in Spain, Sweden, Mexico and the US. His work can be found in private and public collections of the National Museum of Mexican Art, Brauer Art Museum, and the MIIT Museo Internazionale Italia Arte among others.

The human form is the most important element in Sergio’s work and it exists as an anonymous representation of the self. The figure dominates the work and it is depicted as a shadow, aura, ghost or energy light. Sergio is interested in the human and spiritual experience throughout the cycles of life.
521158114671805.name: Gallery13 Opening : From Chicago : GOMEZ/GONSALEZ

544563758991787.description:
Kwaidan/The Fortieth Day + Noise Crush/Bruce Lamont

Tickets:
http://www.ticketweb.com/fb/4132014/mp
Price:
$8.00 (free for CUFF filmmakers & VIPs)
Chicago Underground Film Festival After Party!

KWAIDAN
Kwaidan is a project that brings together Mike Weis (Zelienople), André Foisy (Locrian), and Neil Jendon – when you look at a line-up like this, it’s easy to see how important and profound the outcome will be… Heavy, lumbering, and dense, Kwaidan is a sprawling affair with a foggy aesthetic – bleak, but beautiful and all-surrounding.

THE FORTIETH DAY + NOISE CRUSH
The Fortieth Day is the duo of Isidro Reyes and Mark Solotroff, both key players in the heavy-electronics outfit BLOODYMINDED, a band known for its aggressive and confrontational live shows. Solotroff is also known as the vocalist in the doom/shoegaze band Anatomy of Habit. In The Fortieth Day, Reyes and Solotroff utilize guitar, bass, drum machine, and analog synthesizer to create epic, blackened, psychedelic-industrial drone soundscapes, likened to "sustained, withering blasts of high-pitched noise that are as distinct from one another as spotlights sweeping across the night sky; jackhammer clatter, jet-engine whines, and forlorn keyboard melodies dart in and out of those huge sounds with the grace and impunity of plovers picking a crocodile's teeth" [Bill Meyer, Chicago Reader]
As always for their live performances, the duo will be joined by video artist Lisa Slodki, performing under her Noise Crush moniker. Slodki is is also known for her exhibition and performance series with Chicago trio, Haptic, held at the UBS 12 x 12 Gallery in the Museum of Contemporary Art. Slodki utilizes a battery of VCRs and small video monitors, along with a video mixer and a projector, to present a seamless flow of black and white, primarily abstract, manipulated and looped found footage, resulting in a visual program that emphasizes subtle emotions and gestures and that perfectly compliments the music performed by The Fortieth Day.

BRUCE LAMONT
Bruce Lamont joined Yakuza in February of 2000 and since the group has recorded four full lengths including their latest release "transmutations." In July of 2006 he made his debut solo performance using a looper pedal and effects along with saxophones, guitar, voice, harp, and percussion.

★DJ DELIRIUM
(ISR, MOH, Traxtorm)

Ever since the early 90’s, DJ Delirium has been a forefront leader in the Hardcore Techno scene. He has appeared countless times at some of the worlds largest events like Thunderdome, Mysteryland, Defqon.1, Dominator, In Qontrol, Raving Nightmare, Ground Zero, EDC – Vegas, Earthquake and many more. Delirium has also had tracks featured on some of the worlds most legendary hardcore compilations CD’s including Thunderdome, Always Hardcore, Masters Of Hardcore and Resident E.

To date, DJ Delirium has released over 350 slammin’ tracks with some of the most recognized companies in Hardcore Techno including ID&T, Industrial Strength, Traxtorm, Masters of Hardcore, MegaRave, and many more. DJ Delirium’s got studio skills and has proven that with his top quality productions.

Anyone who’s ever seen DJ Delirium perform knows about his smooth mixing and tight scratching. His DJ skills have taken him all over the world including countries like Holland, Germany, Italy, Belgium, England, Hungary, Canada, Spain and many more places over the years. He has rocked dance floors for crowds of over 30,000 people!

DJ Delirium has brought the hits from the studio to the dance floor for the past 21 years, and there is no sign of stopping him so be prepared for the mantis to strike again!!! = )

★SCOTTY SMALLZ

Rockford, Illinois 

Scotty Smallz always seems to amaze the crowd with his own style of hard beats starting off in 2005 he has been showing the people all over what he can do behind the decks spinning with such artists as Bad boy bill/Reid Speed/Helicopter Showdown /Caffeine And many more he started His love in music at age 17 in the small city of Rockford,IL Inspired by Going to Clubs in Chicagoland Such as Medusa Saturdays/Energy Nightclub And watching fellow djs which landed him his first gig at medusas and that was just the beginning! It wasnt easy at first and still from time to time is not easy but he is now hitting the streets with his music releasing bootlegs and mashups and is going strong to lay the music down in any place as hard as he can to leave a imprint in edm scene !!!!

Milwaukee, Wisconsin

Just a DJ from Milwaukee that specializes in mixing harder styles (hardcore/HHxC/hardstyle/hard dance/hard house/speedcore/etc.), as well as DnB. Trying to help revive the underground from where it has gone now, to what it used to be.

★EDJE

Chicago, Illinois 

Hitting the Hard Dance scene in Chicagoland with a tidal wave of Hard Kicks and Reverse bass. eDJe has been spinnin' in the underground scene since 2009, with his love for house party and raves going all the way back to the mid 90's. His love for the harder stylez was discovered when heard his first hardstyle track. Showtek - F-track. His love for the Harder Stylez of EDM was born. With ifluences ranging from Showtek, Headhunterz, Ran-D, TnT, Zatox, & Fronliner, his mixxes represent the whole range of hardstyle kicks and melodies!

Three Soldiers (For Sisters) is an aggressive retelling of Chekhov's Three Sisters. Where Three Sisters is often about the tragic fall of upper class women, Three Soldiers (For Sisters) is about the difficult climb of our modern warrior class, mixing realism and expressionism with robotic limbs, female soldiers, racial tensions and a terrorist attack. 

Also, dancing. 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qLzusn-_aJo

       The long awaited start of 
 ★★   ßAÐASS Raves Chicago. ★★
         Friday April 18th 2014
________×ღ×_________

We are all UNIQUE - We are all ONE - We are all BADASS
So excited to be back with our Chicago Family. Many of our events will be themed and/or cosplay. This event will be about you Badasses flaunting your individuality, be yourself no matter how outrageous, funky, ratchet or geek that you are!

Hook up epik phats and more from our official sponsor at www.KIKWEAR.com and stay up to date with the company action at www.Facebook.com/KIKWEAR

ღ´*•.¸(*•.¸♥¸.•*´)¸.•*´ღ 
Happy Djs Make Happy Dance Floors.
When you go to hear a Artist at a BADASS event, you will get to enjoy seeing and hearing them the way it should be.
All our artists are treated with respect. They each get at least an hour long timeslot and top of the line gear to play on. 

★★★★:::::: Badass Artists ::::::★★★★

★DA LOLLIPOP KIDS
UK Hardcore - Justice Hardcore, Kikwear, Ohio Hardcore, Good Vibes Promotions/ Columbus, Oh
DLK, Todd "Nobody" Hubbard and Chad "beatz4brainz" Sobers, have now been out on the road for 5+ years, taking their sing-along UK hardcore sets and high energy stage presence all around the country. Early in 2013, on the heels of his 11 releases in 2012, Nobody launched his own label, Justice Hardcore. With support and releases from some of the biggest names in hardcore, the label seems to be rapidly growing in popularity. With the amount of mileage the members of DLK put in weekend after weekend, there's no reason to miss out on the blast you are sure to have whenever they step behind the decks. 
Mix: http://soundcloud.com/da-lollipop-kids 
      http://soundcloud.com/nobodyhardcore
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/dalollipopkids
Website: http://www.justicehardcore.com/
*Justice Hardcore's Releases on Trackitdown.net
http://www.trackitdown.net/recordlabel/135829/justice-hardcore.html

★TIMOTHY GETZ
Breakbeat/Dirty Beatz productions/ Grand rapids, MI
When all else fails bring the bring the heat... This is a statement that is sure to make sense after an hour long set of some of the finest, high energy booty music, the breakbeat world has to offer. Timothy Getz's sound is one that is sure to capture your attention and keep you moving with the kind of tunes that have soul and depth. Since making his presence into the EDM scene in early 2007 he has spent time in nearly every city in the mid west spreading his love for the music and studying what it is that creates "mass movement", Sure crowd control and an enlighten sense of well being for every soul in the room. In his mind this is a Dj's purpose.
Mix: www.Soundcloud.com/timothy_getz
Facebook: www.facebook.com/timothy.getz

★NOTORIOUS NIñO
Hardstyle/Manic Australia, Neon Black Clothing, Badass Raves Chicago - Just back from a 4yr trip to the east coast! 
Owner of Laser Graffiti and recently joined the prestigious B.A.D.A.S.S. Raves family based in Washington DC.
A D.J. that has stood the test of time for over 20 years due to his sets of music that cross genres and generations. Mixing at a range from 32 beat quick mixing up to 5+ min long blends, he tries to create a feeling of continuity between himself & his listeners. In 2011 he finds himself unable to resist the draw to Hardstyle. He found a home where house anthems meet hard 150bpm beats. Banging dancefloors all over the country in a city near you, Check him out live or keep up with recent releases.
Mix: http://soundcloud.com/notoriousnino
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/notoriousnino
Agent Manic productions, Em Thurmer: https://www.facebook.com/manicproductons

★Lvmb & Tvna - Trvp & Dubstep  / Vibetribe, The Trap House / Chicago 
Robbie Serafin and Blake Heyman make up the duo "Lvmb & Tvna” Just getting their start in 2012, Lvmb & Tvna have gone from playing small college shows, to earning a spot at this years Spring Awakening Music Festival. Wether the duo is playing at one of the cities premier clubs, or something a little more underground, these two will guarantee your feet moving and asses shaking. Though focusing mainly on the trap game, these two have no boundaries on genres. Keep a look out for these two!
https://soundcloud.com/lvmb-tvna/bvck-to-the-trvp
https://www.facebook.com/LAMBANDTUNAMUSICZ

★ADONIS CHILDS
aka Sinoda - Mind dance
     Adonis childs has always prided himself on equality of humans of all sorts of age, sex, culture, and music taste bringing humans together for the love of music had always been sinodA's strong point. Adonis has worked with many people across the board when it comes to music and coordinating events. He has a vision that one day people will feel high from the music and a higher consciousness will be created through sound. ADONIS saw the future and would preach we have to keep the fabric of Chicago underground the way it should be the way it always been. These new "rave music" sound turned off the chicago heads and they stayed in the clubs closing their eyes to this cheap atrocity that made somewhat of a mockery of what was. But they kept on moving evolving and standing out from everyone else.
    Adonis noticing that now years has passed and dropping djs names and people saying who? We're talking huge names from people that took off after the down days. At this point Adonis made it his mission to educate about the vibe and the truth growth Chicago rave culture. He was outraged at the lose of soul and spirituality in the music and events that were being passed off as a rave. So he fights to keep all people coming together in the love of music and expanding Mines staying on course. You will look up and hear adonis trying to keep the good in what he has seen over years alive playing Fest, Clubs, and the now commercialism events teaching from the decks bring that trippy vibe he always has but always something new and old as a offering to the spirit of the underground .. THE Prince of ..
Mix: https://soundcloud.com/dj-adonis-childs & https://soundcloud.com/dj-adonis-tfu
Video: http://www.youtube.com/user/truefamilyunit

★CLARK kENTT
House/Vibe Tribe, Source/ Chicago
As Superman frees us from villians Clark Kentt keeps Chicago house muzik locked and steady on his back. Mr Kentt has earned himself a residency in the Chicago Rave Scene along with a list of regular appearances at some of Chicago's premiere nightclubs. This not so Mild Mannered dj has an arsenal of techniques to amaze your eyes (scatching, beat junggling, multiple genres, and live remixing), while your ears get the true sound of  HOUSE. These skills matched with a stage presence of a king and an energy only comparable to pure adrenaline give Clark the necessary tools to become not only an amazing DJ but a true artist behind the decks. Whether it be behind the decks, in the studio, Clark Kentt is truly old school standards meant for new school understanding. Educating the masses and Spreading the True Feeling of House!!!

★MR. BOBBY
Electro/React/Blacklight blackout/Custom Vibes/Front312/Chicago
Mr. Bobby was introduced to the dj/party world through his older brother. He began his musical career promoting for L.I.E. and MAYHEM in the late 90s. Promptly moving on to collaborate with others to form Profound Image containing crowds of around 1000 people. After a good few years he went on to form Profound Music on his own focused on Punk shows. He would also help put together festivals, block parties, art shows and much more. For a short time he formed The Androide Kult with a few others. Not having a DJ name he was dubbed Mr. Bobby. He then moved on to work with many different people who had the same drive to organize events and entertain people with good music. He has worked with Kompute Musik. For a brief period he worked with a few others to have the MYOUR HOUSE parties. He is still currently one of Custom Vibes and is now in the React family.
   Bobby's own music has been on the works for a while as he has collaborated with many musicians. His style jumps from industrial, electronic, ambient, electro, to techno and a touch of Goth.
   When you see him out mixing he can truly try to accommodate to what will make the people move. You can see that throughout his entire life he has been affected by all types and all styles from house, Goth, Indie, Punk, Electro, to the never ending genres the music will grow into. He tries to blend different genres with same sounds together to create his own concoction of sound. His favorite quote is "my life is music and music is life".

586315264798919.description:
Hoy a las 12 horas (hora del centro) inicia la apertura del período de registro Bank of America Chicago Marathon  2014. Tienes hasta el 7 de abril para registrar tu nombre en la lotería de registro sin garantía o seleccione una opción de garantía. Ir a chicagomarathon.com para más detalles

La inscripción para el 2014 Bank of America Chicago Marathon se llevará a cabo mediante un sistema de inscripciones garantizadas e inscripciones no garantizados a través de la lotería. Se limitará a un máximo de 45 000 participantes.
Los interesados en participar podrán:
1) registrarse con una inscripción garantizada (ITP - Voy a Chicago), o 
2) participar en el sorteo de entrada no garantizada, en cualquier momento a partir del miércoles 19 de marzo a las 12 horas, hasta el lunes 7 de abril a las 12 pm, hora del centro EE.UU.. Participantes en la Lotería serán notificados de su condición de selección el lunes 14 de abril.
Continúe leyendo para obtener más detalles sobre las opciones de inscripciones garantizados y no garantizadas para el 2014 Bank of America Chicago Marathon.
http://www.chicagomarathon.com/participant-information/registration/
586315264798919.name: Chicago Marathon - Inscripciones Garantizadas

590302534386568.description:
La Compagnia Next Artists con la preziosa collaborazione registica di Mara Mazzei  vi presenta: CHICAGO the Musical.
Un tuffo nella città di Chicago degli anni '20 dove vi aspettano la star Velma e le sue compagne di cella, l'aspirante star Roxie e suo marito Amos, la spumeggiante custode del carcere Mama Morton, e l'affascinante avvocato difensore Billy Flinn. La lunga corsa al successo di Roxie è interrotta da un processo per omicidio, ma nonostante venga dichiarata innocente, non riesce più a far Tremare Chicago e, insieme al suo mito Velma, anch'essa assolta per omicidio e alla disperata ricerca di un lavoro, mettono su un numero e riescono a tornare a essere famose.
Uno spettacolo spumeggiante, divertente, ricco di intrigo di suspance e di passione, interamente in lingua inglese.
Vi aspettiamo per rivevere insieme a noi la brillante atmosfera degli anni Venti.

Per informazioni e acquisto biglietti: 
329.6255133
segreterianextartists.it

HardEnergy events  present ,,EuroTRIP"  event again in 69 below. This time we have another guest from  Stay Up Forever Collective CHICAGO LOOP and BENJI303 also our residents.
-----------------------------------
Chicago Loop is the brand new alias from Ant, a techno DJ and producer from
the U.K who has been involved in the scene for 2 decades, playing
worldwide and releasing hundreds of tracks.
This new focus is on fresh and modern techno and after only 6 months, some of his
first "Chicago Loop" releases have appeared on Respekt Recordings, Renesanz,
Keep On Techno and Naked Lunch (under Smoke & Dub) and has had tracks
remixed by Tomy DeClerque, Spektre and Balthazar & JackRock. He has just
recently signed a vinyl only EP to Praxxiz records, owned and run by the father of
the Berlin Love Parade himself, Dr. Motte.
Currently working on new tracks and remixes in the studio, as well as forming a
new project with Mike Humphries, Chicago Loop is always pushing for an
exciting new take on the modern techno sound of today.
Chicago Loop Links
web: http://www.chicagoloopmusic.com
beatport: http://beatport.com/artist/chicago-loop/42603
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/chicagolooptechno

The Flow Show 2014
Flow Arts Showcase Coming to Chicago

Save the Dates:
March 28th - 30th

TICKETS ON SALE NOW!!

https://www.vendini.com/ticket-software.html?t=tix&e=d25c8ce4fff893d6f877681a9be29cc6

We proudly announce that the Flow Show, a showcase of some of the country's best talent in the flow arts, will be coming to Chicago in 2014! Chicago is honored to be the third city selected for this intimate celebration of movement and community. As proved in other cities, this two night spectacle of object manipulation and technical dance composition is certain to leave a memorable impression on the Windy City.

Flow Show Chicago will take place at Studio 773, a recently renovated theatre with black box elegance of draped curtains and modern architecture. The venue is located one mile west of Lake Michigan and is conveniently nestled within unique dining and shopping experiences. 

The Flow Show anticipates a delightful evening. Since it's birth in San Francisco, 2009, the Flow Show has been met with consistently sold out performances and rave reviews, providing audiences with inspiration and excitement for a growing art form. 

Flow arts communities across the country, from San Francisco to Brooklyn, New York are teaming with creativity and talent, each with their own unique local flair. The Midwest, too, is home to a thriving community of object manipulation enthusiasts and performers. It is only natural that Flow Show Chicago 2014 is born. With only 150 seats available at Studio 773, Chicago anticipates a full house.

www.theflowshow.org
TICKETS ON SALE NOW!!
https://www.vendini.com/ticket-software.html?t=tix&e=d25c8ce4fff893d6f877681a9be29cc6

www.orinaftaly.com

Review about us:
"Happy for Good" CD Review – American Blues Scene: http://www.americanbluesscene.com/2013/07/the-ori-naftaly-band-is-happy-for-good/
"Happy For Good" CD Review – UK Jazz Radio: www.orinaftaly.com/cd-review---ian-mchugh-tonemonkey-uk.html

www.orinaftaly.com/bluesmagazinenl-cd-review.html
Jerusalem Post Interview: www.orinaftaly.com/jerusalem-post-interview.html

B.L.U.E.S. on Halsted
Chicago B.L.U.E.S. Bar has been voted best blues club on Chicago’s north side. It offers the assurance of good music in a friendly, intimate environment.  Whether you are an invested blues aficionado, or just a blues browser, you’ll enjoy B.L.U.E.S. A trip here is a no-risk venture into some reliably good music. And this stands true seven days a week, 365 days a year.

B.L.U.E.S. features primarily local artists like Lil Ed, John Primer, Big Time Sarah, Vance “Guitar” Kelly and Pistol Pete.  The atmosphere is friendly and intimate. Stretching along its right side is a long bar, and along its left side a riser for overflow seating.

Small tables mold parties into intimate groups, fostering a close atmosphere amongst friends and neighbors. The set-up is such that no matter where you sit, you’re always in the middle of the action. You might find yourself elbow to elbow with your favorite blues artist having a drink on his or her day off.

$130 per person

***************************************************

3186 Hwy 1496
Louisa, KY 41230 

Make checks payable to: Brenda Curry

***************************************************
Itinerary:
Day 1
Depart from Louisa, KY on Friday, June 27th at 6:00 p.m. Please arrive by 5:30pm at Louisa Middle School parking lot (50 Bulldog Lane, Louisa, KY 41230). When you arrive we will line you up by your bus. No one can load the bus until we check off our bus list. Stop to eat. Load bus, relax and watch a movie on the bus. Make several stops to stretch legs and for the ones that need a smoke break. Sleep on bus. Before arriving in Chicago we will stop at a TA to change clothes & freshen up for the day or take a shower (optional).

Day 2
We will arrive in Chicago by 9:00 a.m. Explore Chicago on your own. We will do bus check list at 11:30 p.m. Head home - Sleep on bus

Day 3
Arrive back to Louisa Middle School around 1:00 p.m.

*****************************************************
Deposits and Final Payments:
Deposits are due 15 days after reserving your seats unless we are within the 60 day window of final payments. Initial deposits are non-refundable but can be transferred to another trip prior to final payment date. when resulting in cancellations that reduce the group's size/hotel deposit. If a trip is cancelled by the host or bus company, all travelers enrolled at the time of cancellation may be entitled to a full refund (as determined by cancellation policies of individual vendors). 

Final payment is due 60 days prior to the departure date of the tour. If you cancel prior to the 60 days all funds will be returned except the $50 Initial deposits which is non-refundable but can be transferred to another trip prior to final payment date. If payments or deposits are not received we would unfortunately have to remove you from our reservation list. We will gladly accept payments throughout the year for any of our tours. 

"BAM Bus Tour" acts as an agent reserving hotels and other accommodations/attractions and cannot be held responsible for non performance of hotels and other providing services for our tours. We reserve the right to alter/change the itinerary if it becomes necessary. Liability cannot be claimed for delays caused by acts of God, public enemies, authorities of law, break downs & road or weather conditions beyond human control. In the event of a delay with unplanned overnight stay you would be responsible for your room, board and any other expenses that might occur.

Children 4 years old or older recommended
***********************************************


Top Attractions:
Navy Pier, Millennium Park, The Magnificent Mile

Chicago CityPASS - Is a booklet of VIP admission tickets to Chicago’s 5 best attractions

SHEDD AQUARIUM From whales to snails, tarantulas to turtles, angelfish to zebra sharks, meet 32,000 animals from aquatic habitats around the world. Sharks cruise overhead, stingrays swim below your feet, and belugas smile at eye level. Penguins fly through chilly waters, dolphins leap into the air, and sea jellies pulse to the ocean’s rhythm. Shedd Aquarium is the "must-sea" destination in Chicago!

SKYDECK CHICAGO No trip to Chicago is complete without experiencing The Ledge - glass floor balconies 103 floors over Chicago! Skip the cashier line with this ticket and treat yourself to unparalleled, 360-degree views of up to four states from the top of the world-renowned Willis Tower (formerly Sears Tower), the Western Hemisphere’s tallest building. Interactive exhibits, photo ops and a 9-minute theater presentation on Chicago and Willis Tower’s rise to prominence provide a memorable, one-stop Chicago experience!

THE FIELD MUSEUM With 4.6 billion years under one roof, The Field Museum is your passport to travel the world and back in time! Come face to face with SUE, the T. rex. Descend into an ancient Egyptian tomb or shrink to the size of a bug in Underground Adventure. Now, you can see it all, including special exhibitions and a 3D film!

JOHN HANCOCK OBSERVATORY What Chicago Tribune calls "Chicago’s Best Views." Take America’s fastest elevators more than 1,000 feet above The Magnificent Mile® for the full 360- degree view of Chicago. Taste test our Lavazza Espression concept café, the country's highest café and bar.

ADLER PLANETARIUM Explore the Universe at America’s first planetarium. See NASA’s Gemini 12 space capsule in Shoot for the Moon. Take a space adventure with young visitors in Planet Explorers. Experience the mysteries of our solar system in exhibition galleries and theaters
606490049389381.name: Chicago, IL  Red Eye; June 27th, 28th, & 29th, 2014

606695759399696.description:
► Denne lørdagskvelden har vi den store gleden av å kunne by på en skikkelig godbit for alle som elsker stilren Chicago-blues. Nå er de klare for GT Bluesklubb!
► En felles interesse for den gode, gamle Chicago-bluesen førte dette bandet sammen i 1996. Repertoaret speiler utviklingen fra akustisk deltablues til elektrisk ”storbyjungel”. Med CDen ”Rockin’ Feet” (1998) viste bandet at det heller ikke skorter på originalitet og eget låtmateriale. Chicago Bound leverer varene rått, svingende og blått. Bandnavnet har de for øvrig lånt fra en Jimmy Rogers låt fra 50-tallet.
► Vokalist og bassist Frode Larsen har fartstid fra bluesbandet Larsen’s Last Chance og har de senere årene hovedsakelig spilt i Patey’s Pipe, samt en del freelance-jobbing. Under eget navn har han gitt ut platene: ”Jukeboxman”(2002) og ”Hard Luck And Trouble”(2007).
► Kurt Slevingen er en intens og særdeles sjelfull gitarist. Han er i besittelse av solide kunnskaper om de forskjellige blues-stilartene og gir alt når han står på scenen. Han startet bandet Blue Soul i Bergen på 80-tallet, og litt senere begynte samarbeidet med munnspiller Eirek Sandnes i Bluebirds og Oslo Bluesband, før Chicago Bound oppsto i 1996. Debutskiva, ”West Side From The East Side”, kom i 2002.
► Raufossingen Eirek Sandnes er en veteran i miljøet og anses av mange å være Norges fremste bluesmunnspiller. Denne mannen er en virtuoso på sitt instrument og har blåst blåtoner i band som Vidar Busk , Knut Reiersrud Band , Sunnyland Slim, Sven Zetterberg , Jaybirds, Sugar Daddies, Little Itch og Oslo Bluesband. Samtidig som han er en suveren eksponent for munnspill-tradisjonen til Little Walter Jacobs/Kim Wilson, behersker han også til fulle et mer akustisk sound ala Sonny Boy Williamson II.
► Espen A. Moen har gjennom mange års turnering med et utall av artister og band, etablert seg som en av Norges mest etterspurte blues-trommiser. Listen over freelance-oppdrag er lang, og han er også fast medlem av Tiger City Jukes og Eagle Ridin’ Papas.
606695759399696.name: Chicago Bound med original besetningen

612267792196772.description:
This August Justin and Chris return to the windy city for some mid-western therapeutic bliss. Give your body and being the gift of learning to give and receive, immersed in the world of yoga, flying therapeutics, Thai massage and other bodywork modalities. Harness the power of gravity and explore new freedoms in three-dimensional healing touch. Relax into the rejuvenating power of supportive community... Come fly with us!

This immersion teaches valuable tools for yoga teachers, massage therapists and physical therapists who want to develop their capacity to heal using their hands, and fulfills one of the prerequisites for the AcroYoga Teacher Training. This event also qualifies for 30 contact hours as part of the One Yoga USA TT and Yoga 4 Love Advanced Trainings; a certificate of completion will be given at the end of the 5 days. No previous experience or partner necessary. This training is for everybody; you do not have to be a yogi or have practiced acro.

To Register: 
http://clients.mindbodyonline.com/ws.asp?studioid=520&stype=-101&sView=day&sTrn=100000074

Questions: chris@acroyoga.org, 570.460.6824

Location:
3113 North Lincoln Avenue Chicago, IL 60657

Investment:
Full 5 days Early-Bird until July 23rd: $435
Full 5 days from July 24th on: $535
Saturday only day rate: $108

Schedule:
Sat - Wed 10am - 5:30pm

What is AcroYoga?
AcroYoga blends the wisdom of yoga, the dynamic power of acrobatics, and the loving kindness of healing arts. These three lineages form the foundation of a practice that cultivates trust, playfulness, and community. In this immersion we will focus on the Lunar Healing Arts Practices that cultivate listening, loving and letting go and Yogic Practices that cultivate breathe awareness, life balance and connection.

AcroYoga is a space to:

- Heal the body
- Learn to massage both on the floor and in the air
- Play with freedom
- Connect profoundly both with both yourself and with friends
- Break the barriers of what you believe impossible
- Conquer gravity
- Take off in flight
- Join the world community of AcroYoga
… and smile a ton!


About Justin Caruso:
Justin feels the body to be a reflection of life: an ecstatic temple, a work of art, and a vehicle for connection. Just before the financial crisis Justin made a timely exit from Wall Street to return to yoga, a practice he began over fifteen years ago. A New York native, Justin has spent the past seven years traveling extensively through South America, Asia and the US, teaching and studying yoga, AcroYoga, bodywork and water therapies with many of the world's master teachers of the healing arts.

About Chris Loebsack:
Chris Loebsack 500hr E-RYT uses the power of yoga to create space for students that cultivates trust playfulness and connection within themselves and their communities. Living by her mantra, Clarity, Integrity and Love, she draws upon her AcroYoga Practice to share the healing power of touch and safe intimacy. She is a valuable mentor to many upcoming educators. 

Testimonials:

"Thank you for such an incredible experience you just facilitated. You are gifted teachers, really. The material was presented with such ease; in an accessible, thorough, as well as FUN way! The healing that came from Thai Massage ( every morning ), and the playful laughter from flight; I truly feel nourished, inspired, and transformed. My deepest gratitude."

"Thank YOU for passing on and spreading your beautiful loving Energy. I missed going to the immersion this morning. Even though i went back to the same routine as before, today was a different day. Eternally grateful for having the opportunity to be your student for a few days.
Many more will come. Muchas bendiciones y mucho amor"

"Still riding so high on the waves of love shared at the lunar immersion in Miami! I am left with so many images from that weekend that make me weep from the pure beauty and loving that was embodied so perfectly in yourself, Chris, Ari and Lau! You've touched me profoundly and inspired me deeply! HUGE gratitude...thank you!"

"I am singing praises for the connectedness and receptivity that I was blessed to experience this past week. Weaving threads of trust and surrender into one mandala of supreme symmetry, balance, and love. Learning how to allow my inner light to sink deeper into a space that homes boundless expansion. If we can move with ease and grace in our lives with an open accepting unconditional love for ourselves, only then can we truly give love to others. I am a conduit of radiance that is open to shine and was born to shine. Thank you from the bottom of my heart Chris Loebsack and Justin Caruso for awakening these gems of wisdom within me. I will never forgot our Lunar Immersion together and the beautiful sangha that was created. Endless gratitude to the divine healing in AcroYoga"


"Last year, when I saw the amazing cast of great teachers that was going to teach this immersion I decided wholeheartedly to dive in. I rest reassured that that was one of the best ways to start 2013. I'm deeply inspired by where you have taken your practice (and where it has taken you) and feel grateful for how generous is your desire to share it. As it is with those souls that inject one's life with the substance of spiritual growth, I rest comfortably assured that there will be more opportunities for sharing the same space and share some love."

"Justiiiiiiiiin GRACIASSSS! THANK YOUUU! It was a truly amazing experience. I joined the Lunar Immersion to put myself outside of my comfort zone. At first I thought I was just going to be a spectator not having any experience but your teaching techniques were flawless and I very quickly felt like I was part of it all. I LOVE LOVE LOVE the aspect of giving in Acro Yoga I had a very big need to channel my need to give in a loving and nurturing way. Receiving was too much to handle! (No words to describe) The whole experience filled me with a renewed energy. My students have not stoped commenting that I look so happy. It was such a great investment. I still don't have the confidence to fly them or try any of the techniques but I do have my 6 yr old daughter and she is my little person to practice with. I still have to keep learning so for now I will continue to study as much Acro yoga as I can. Thank you for coming to Puerto Rico, for being such a great instructor, for sharing your light and for doing what you do. I wish you a whole lot of goodness!!!! I hope our paths cross again soon Big Hug"
612267792196772.location: Ganesha Yoga and Adventures in Fitness
612267792196772.name: Chicago AcroYoga Lunar Immersion with Justin Caruso and Chris Loebsack

623517041055498.description:
WIN A SIX-DAY MICHFEST TICKET!!
The Night Stage features surf punk dance-band Venus in Furs, Chicago's legendary Drum Divas, Poet Warrior Extraordinaire C.C. Carter, Louise Cloutier's burn-down-the-house a cappella, swoon-worthy kings Style & Swagg, and fire goddess Terri Burch.

$5-$10 suggested donation
No one turned away for lack of funds

Join 400 hundred women “on the land” at the Abbey, for dancing, live performances, and mingling in the Twilight Zone, Bush Garden Lounge, Triangle Fire, and Night Stage. And, you never know what might happen on Lois Lane...

TRIANGLE FIRE JAM
Triangle Fire Jam features the very talented Aerin Tedesco, Andrea Bunch, Jenny Urban, Maria Gullo, Angelisa Crognale, Amelia Starnsta, Betsy Odom, Angie Maloney and special guests. Gather round the fire pit for some fierce singer-songwriters. Bring your instrument and join in. 

Dance all night, feel the Michfest love, and help us raise money to send women to Festival! Last year we gave away 10 tickets from the FREE DRAWING to women who needed support to get to festival. Come to the party to enter the free drawing!!

Arrive Early!
Early Bird Raffle Drawing at 8:30pm
FREE RAFFLE TICKET at the door if you arrive by 8:30pm
Triangle Fire Music Jam 8pm-9:00pm 
CC Carter Line Dance Lessons 9:00pm
DJs and Live Performances all night

New Venue!
We outgrew the Holiday Club and our new host is The Abbey, Chicago's famous concert pub. The Abbey has a big beautiful stage and dancing til 2am, so bring your friends and share that Michfest love. In addition to the fundraising raffle, any woman can enter the FREE DRAWING to be eligible to win a ticket to festival. Last year, we raised enough money to give Michfest tickets to 10 women. The FREE DRAWING is for women who self-identify as "needing help" to get to festival this year. You can only enter if you attend party, so join us for a great night and a good chance for a free ticket. 

FABULOUS RAFFLE PRIZES
Six Day Michfest Ticket Grand Prize!!
Plus Concert tickets, CDs, Yoga memberships, Dykey Films, Bar Tabs, Michfest Swag, Women & Children First Gift Certificate, and dozens of great prizes. 

Your Party hosts:

Brenda Schumacher, Pat McCombs, Marla Nitt, Julie King, Patience Meeks, Sherry Wright, Marie Walz, Valentia Gaglio, Amigas Latinas, and Pow Wow

Join Chicago Michfest Facebook Group at www.facebook.com/groups/Chicagomichfest

**Party proceeds will fund tickets for women who need help to get to Festival. 

More info: www.facebook.com/groups/Chicagomichfest or flybike7@gmail.com

ABOUT MICHFEST: 

The 39th Annual Michfest is happening August 5-10, 2014, and we are starting the party early. Whether this is your 1st year or 39th year going to Fest, come out to celebrate with us and get ready for the best Michfest ever!

This August, hundreds of Chicago women are heading north to Hart, Michigan to attend the legendary Michfest. We will join thousands of women from across the globe in this paradise on 650 gorgeous acres of woods, ferns and rolling fields. Don't miss what will be one of the greatest experiences of your life with music, dancing, workshops, delicious food, parties, bon fires, hiking, and camping. You will find an amazing feeling of community, friendship, openness, and high-energy fun. 

Whether you like quiet hikes and movies under the stars, workshops on everything from kissing (um, a hands on class) to singing to trapeze tricks to finances--or if you prefer mosh pits, crowd surfing and late night parties deep in the woods, you will have the time of your life as part of this amazingly diverse community that is Michfest.

Join us at the the Abbey on April 26th for a great party, and to learn more and meet some amazing women. We will have info on tickets, ride shares, and all things festival. And we’ll raise money to buy tickets for those who need help. Come to the party to enter a free drawing for a Festival ticket.
623517041055498.name: Chicago’s Half-Way to Michfest Party: Day Stage Disco

625744010783805.description:
Join us at The Whistler on April 7th at 9pm!

We continue the 5th Anniversary Season of what Thrillist Chicago calls one of the best karaoke spots in the city.

Here's how to participate:
1) Choose a scene.
2) Have a drink.
3) Get on stage.
4) Be awesome.

(repeat as necessary)

For those who don't know, "movieoke" is a portmanteau of "movie" and "karaoke". Instead of songs, you quote a movie scene of your choice as it plays for you and the audience (captions will be provided). It's free to participate, but if you do order a drink at the bar, be sure to tip your bartenders. ;-)

If you can't make it, feel free to invite others who may be interested! This event page will be updated every month, so even if you can't make it one month, keep an eye on this page for future Movieoke dates.

Join in on the fun! Like Chicago Movieoke here on Facebook, follow @ChicagoMovieoke on Twitter, or visit ChicagoMovieoke.com for the latest info!
625744010783805.name: Chicago Movieoke: April 2014

626949904041839.description:
Tickets:
http://www.ticketweb.com/fb/4113194/mayne

Price:
$33.00 - $43.00

Additional Info:
An evening of Jazz music, Champagne, Specialty Cocktails, Gourmet Delicacies by Chef Dejan and more......

All tickets include delicious appetizers and 2 drinks, your choice of champagne or the evening's specialty cocktails:the favorites of jazz icons Billie Holiday,Chet Baker, Frank Sinatra and Nat King Cole.

Charbonier will perform a selection of songs as made famous by the above mentioned jazz vocalists. 

Also performed will be medleys of songs written by John Lennon & Paul McCartney as well as Hal David & Burt Bachurach.

Accompanied by Adrian Ruiz on piano, Michael Lough on bass, Nils Hidgon on drums and Shaun Johnson on trumpet the evening will take you on a musical journey of the 1930's to the 1960's.

Special guest performers include the legendary Joel Hall Dancers premiering a new piece to Charbonier's Stormy Weather!

Be the first to see Charbonier's world premiere music video of his new single, "You've Been Dreaming" 

On the Mayne Stage's big screen, enjoy the video highlights of Charbonier's December album release party.

Feast your eyes on a sampling of the vintage car collection of Lou Rugani.

Remember, it's a Spring Soiree so dress in your Sunday best!

Jazz vocalist/songwriter, film and music producer Jesse Charbonier has just released his first album, Jesse Charbonier: Live at the Vic Theatre - Chicago.  In that album he pays tribute to the iconic jazz vocalists of the 20th Century. Click the link to get a taste of that album and his live performance. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WF_7Ov4k6zI

Presently he performs regularly at Chicago's iconic Drake Hotel in its legendary Coq d' Or Lounge with his trio to rave reviews since the summer of 2011.

Let's Not Discuss It. Charbonier's first single release co-written with composer Federico D' Antoni, and produced by Juan Manzur has been gaining momentum and is at the top of the ReverbNation Jazz Charts. The accompanying music video produced by Charbonier and directed by Tadeo Garcia and Mario Carrasco, has been called "A Mastepiece" "Cinematic",& "Breathtaking" Click the link to view the music video. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BMch4bZTroQ

Charbonier, also has performed at venues such New York City Henry's Restaurant and Lounge (formerly Birdland), Chicago's Vic Theatre and now Chicago's Mayne Stage, as well as for such prestigious organizations as The Chicago International Film Festival.

To learn more visit his website: www.JesseCharbonier.com
626949904041839.name: A Spring Soiree with JESSE CHARBONIER at the MAYNE STAGE - Chicago - Featuring the Gourmet delicacies of CHEF DEJAN and a special performance by the legendary JOEL HALL DANCERS

629982833707711.description:
The Luau tournament is in its 19th year and takes place in beautiful Chicago, IL. Soak up both the sun and spectacular views of the Chicago skyline and Lake Michigan while you play!

The Luau is Chicago’s largest grass volleyball event for all levels of play and boasts over 2,500 participants. Tournament play begins in the morning with the Bud Light beer truck parked right up on the grass to get the party started! Entry fee for the event includes tournament play, food, beer & a DJ music all day. Spectators are encouraged and welcome to come; a wristband can be purchased and includes all-you-can-eat and drink during the day. Huge cash prizes for the top levels, costume contest info, sponsored games/contests with prizes and more to come! Stay tuned for info on the post party!

You must be 21 years old to participate in the event. Rain or shine - no refunds.

More info and registration coming soon!

645474302168148.description:
PASSWORD is "BOND" for reduced entry and LADIES FREE ALL NIGHT... ONLY with password.

Gabriel & Dresden 

For electronic dance music fanatics, the year 2011 marks a new musical promise. After three years of work apart, the critically acclaimed and multiple award winning duo of Josh Gabriel and Dave Dresden are back together with a new energy and spirit. 

In 2001, Josh and Dave joined forces under the now legendary Gabriel & Dresden moniker. Within their 6 years of collaboration, Gabriel & Dresden scored 19 number 1 Billboard Hot Dance/Club Play remixes and tracks, made three DJ-mixed compilation albums, an artist album and won seven International Dance Music Awards. Their tracks 'Arcadia', 'Dangerous Power', 'Let Go', 'Tracking Treasure Down' Andain "Beautiful Things" and numerous other masterpieces have turned into some of EDM’s biggest classics. 'As The Rush Comes', by their Motorcycle alias with Jes Brieden, they won the IDMA award for 'Best Progressive Trance Track' as well as peaking at #11 on the official UK top40 charts. The G&D treatment, through remixes and interpretations, was given to tracks by The Killers, Annie Lenox, Sarah McLachlan, Dido, Tiësto, Paul Oakenfold and Way Out West, making their sound cross borders from trance and progressive with pop, indie and soul sensibilities.

In 2008 After 6+ years of hits and and awards, both guys felt it was time for something new and took a break from Gabriel & Dresden to focus on their individual careers. Inspiration came flowing with the new tide. After the split, Josh Gabriel set up his own label, 'Different Pieces' and focused on his Winter Kills and Andain projects. On his album 'Eight', Josh intertwined techno and house into pieces of pure electronic bliss. In the meantime, Dave Dresden took charge of the dancefloor with his Dresden & Johnston project and spawned a US radio hit in the song 'Keep Faith' and "That Day" (with Nadia Ali on lead vocals), as well as remixes for the likes of Owl City, Nadia Ali, BT and The Crystal Method. But you simply can't stop musical synergy. 

As 2010 came to an end, Gabriel and Dresden decided to go back to their roots and reunite at the Hollywood Palladium in Los Angeles for New Year’s Eve 2011. Their return behind the decks showed that after two and a half years apart, nothing really changed. Gabriel & Dresden's comeback marks one of the most notable moments in EDM this year, finally answering the call of millions of dance lovers. With gigs at some of the world's biggest festivals, clubs and events planned and a new compilation in the making, Gabriel & Dresden are all set to do what they love most: celebrate music. And we're all invited.
